0.title: It was an amazing fight, we could have done better: Dasun after loss to Eng
0.article_body: After losing to England on Saturday, Sri Lankan skipper Dasun Shanaka said that it was an "amazing fight". "We could have done better. I think the wicket played a part in this game...It was the powerplay where we didn't bowl well, they (England) played well," Shanaka said. He added, "Catching has been a problem...we need to go back and improve."

1.title: Pakistan secures $13 bn in financial aid from China & Saudi Arabia: Report
1.article_body: Pakistan has secured $9 billion from China and $4 billion from Saudi Arabia in financial aid on top of assurances for about $20 billion in investments, the Dawn newspaper reported. During Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif's recent Beijing visit, China also agreed to fast-track the processing for a $9.8 billion high-speed rail project from Karachi to Peshawar, the report added.

2.title: 'Jana Gana Mana' & 'Vande Mataram' must be given the same level of respect: Govt
2.article_body: The national anthem of India ('Jana Gana Mana') and the national song ('Vande Mataram') have equal status, the Centre has told Delhi High Court. Every Indian citizen must show the same level of respect to both songs, the Ministry of Home Affairs said. 'Vande Mataram' has a "unique and special place in the emotions...of the people of India," it added.

3.title: PM Modi visits Radha Soami Satsang Beas dera, meets Baba Dhillon
3.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday visited Radha Soami Satsang Beas dera in Punjab and met its chief Baba Gurinder Singh Dhillon. The PM also went to the community kitchen where women followers were preparing food. Earlier, he hailed the community service efforts undertaken by the organisation. The dera has followers in several states, including Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and Rajasthan.

4.title: These situations are built for Stokes: Buttler after win over Sri Lanka
4.article_body: After winning against Sri Lanka, England skipper Jos Buttler said that these situations are made for all-rounder Ben Stokes who scored a match-winning 42*(36) on Saturday. "He (Stokes) can play a lot of roles for us in this T20 setup...[Sri Lanka] got off to a really good start...But the way Adil Rashid got us back was wonderful," Buttler said.

5.title: Dover immigration centre attack was a terrorist incident: UK police
5.article_body: British police on Saturday said evidence showed the petrol bomb attack on the Dover immigration facility last week was a terrorist incident motivated by an extreme right-wing ideology. "There's currently nothing to suggest the offender was working alongside anyone else," police added. There are strong indications that the suspect's mental health was also a factor in the attack, police said.

6.title: Will never happen: SRK to fan asking about Kardashian-like show on his family
6.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan, during an #AskSRK session on Twitter, replied to a fan who asked, "If you and your family had a TV show like the Kardashians, what would it be called?" The actor responded, "It will never happen we are a very private family...but Khandaan I guess??!" On the work front, Shah Rukh will be seen in 'Pathaan'.

7.title: Postpone rear seat belt rule till Dec 31: Mumbai Taxi Union to police
7.article_body: The Mumbai Taxi Union has written to the Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) requesting him to postpone the implementation of the rear passenger seat belt to December 31. The Union said many operators had removed the rear seat belt and there was a delay in availability. The Union also welcomed the decision to impose fines on passengers and not drivers.

8.title: Varun breaks down remembering late driver, says 'I'm still dealing with it'
8.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan broke down in tears while remembering his late driver Manoj Sahu at a recent event. Manoj, who had been with him for 26 years, passed away after suffering a heart attack earlier this year. Talking about his demise, Varun said, "It's taken me...long time to find...courage to talk about this. But, honestly, I'm still dealing with it."

9.title: Delhi's pupil-teacher ratio for upper primary worst in India: Report
9.article_body: Delhi has the poorest student-teacher ratio in the upper primary school level (classes VI to VIII) in the country for 2021-22, the Unified District Information System for Education Plus said. The ratio of teacher-pupil in the upper primary level in Delhi is 33:1. In the primary level (classes I to V), Delhi has the second poorest student-teacher ratio after Bihar.

10.title: TN man picking his daughter assaulted by youths outside college
10.article_body: A video showing some youths allegedly assaulting a 50-year-old man who had come to pick up his daughter from Sri Meenakshi Government Arts College for Women in Tamil Nadu's Madurai has surfaced online. Police said a funeral procession was passing near the college entrance when the students were exiting the college. Six people have been arrested so far, police added.

11.title: Heavy rainfall, thunderstorm warning issued for several states for next few days
11.article_body: As per IMD, heavy rainfall is very likely over Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Jammu & Kashmir on Sunday. It is very likely over Andaman and Nicobar Islands from November 6 to 8. Thunderstorm accompanied with lightning is very likely over Tamil Nadu on Sunday. It is very likely over Kerala and Puducherry from November 6 to 9.

12.title: Everything was so public, I felt haunted: Selena on breakup with Justin Bieber
12.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez opened up about her breakup with Justin Bieber and said, "Everything was so public. I felt haunted by a past relationship that no one wanted to let go of." "I feel like I'd to go through the worst possible heartbreak ever," she added. Selena and Justin broke up in 2018 after an on-off relationship of eight years.

13.title: Mumbai Congress leader booked for cheating jeweller of ₹17.5 lakh
13.article_body: A Congress leader has been booked by Mumbai Police for allegedly cheating a jeweller of ₹17.5 lakh. Mumbai Congress General Secretary Mohan Singh Saini allegedly took the money promising high returns but used it to fund his son's studies. Saini claims the money was to fund the studies but the complainant demanded exorbitant interest when he tried to return it.

14.title: Make field visits, step up surveillance: UP CM to officials amid dengue cases
14.article_body: Amid the rising dengue cases in Uttar Pradesh, CM Yogi Adityanath on Saturday held a meeting with state health department officials and directed nodal officers to make field visits. He also instructed them to step up surveillance in the affected areas. "All municipal corporations and local bodies...should conduct special campaigns on cleanliness, fogging and anti-larva spray," he added.

15.title: Christian monastery pre-dating Islam discovered on UAE island
15.article_body: An ancient Christian monastery possibly dating back to the period preceding the emergence of Islam in the Arabian Peninsula has been discovered in the UAE, officials announced on Thursday. The monastery has been discovered on Siniyah Island of Umm Al Quwain emirate. Carbon dating indicates the samples found in the monastery's foundation date as far back as 534 AD.

16.title: 60,000 Yaba tablets worth ₹15 crore seized from Manipur man in Assam
16.article_body: Assam Police on Saturday arrested a Manipur-based man from the Sonapur area of Kamrup Metropolitan district for allegedly transporting over 60,000 Yaba tablets worth ₹15 crore, an official said. According to police, the tablets were seized from a four-wheeler vehicle coming from the Meghalaya side. "Commendable feat," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma wrote while sharing the information on Twitter.

17.title: Not great: Mark Wood on attack on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan
17.article_body: England's Mark Wood said that the attack on ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan is "not great". "He's an ex-cricketer, so it's close to home for us," Wood said. He added, "We were looked after really well (during the tour to Pakistan in September-October 2022) but I'd be lying if I said I wasn't worried by that because you're going back there."

18.title: Password attacks rise to 921 every second globally: Microsoft
18.article_body: According to Microsoft's 'Digital Defense Report 2022', the volume of password attacks has risen to an estimated 921 attacks every second globally, a 74% increase in just one year. The report added Microsoft removed over 10,000 domains used by cybercriminals. From July 2021 to June 2022, Microsoft's digital defence teams blocked 34.7 billion identity threats and 37 billion email threats.

19.title: Producer alleges SRK's Jawan's story is copied from a Tamil film, files complaint
19.article_body: Producer Manickam Narayanan has alleged that Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film Jawan's story has been copied from Tamil film 'Perarasu'. Manickam has filed a complaint with the Tamil Film Producers Council (TFPC), accusing Jawan makers of plagiarism. TFPC board members will be investigating the complaint filed by Manickam after November 7, reports said.

20.title: I have told people to not call me a legend or veteran: Anupam Kher
20.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher said that he does not carry the burden of being a senior actor as doing so makes his life and job easy. "I have told people to not call me a legend or veteran, or uncle for that matter," Anupam said. "I don't allow that because these are the clichés decided by society," he added.

21.title: IT dept raids offices of former MLA Zulfikar Ahmed Bhutto in UP, other states
21.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) department on Saturday conducted raids at the house, offices and factory of former BSP MLA and meat exporter Zulfikar Ahmed Bhutto. The raids were carried out in Uttar Pradesh, Delhi, Chandigarh (Punjab), Jaipur (Rajasthan), Aurangabad (Maharashtra), and Nuh (Haryana). They also searched the AOV Slaughter House of HMA Group in Unnao.

22.title: Tower D of Gurugram’s Chintels Paradiso Society to be demolished
22.article_body: Tower D of Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso Society will be demolished as per the recommendations of a report by IIT, Delhi, said Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav on Saturday. A structural audit of the tower was conducted after a portion of an apartment collapsed in February this year, killing two women. The tower has over 50 flats.

23.title: 36th edition of Pune International Marathon to be held on December 4
23.article_body: The 36th edition of the Pune International Marathon will be held on December 4. The run will start at midnight and end at 9 am. "The night timing helps us to conduct a smooth race and we can avoid traffic chaos," said the President of Pune International Marathon Trust. The men's and women's full marathon will be 42.195 km long.

24.title: BJP MP Rita found guilty of model code violation during 2012 UP polls
24.article_body: A special court on Friday found BJP MP Rita Bahuguna Joshi and four others guilty of violating the Model Code of Conduct during the 2012 Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. Rita, who was a Congress leader in 2012, had allegedly addressed a rally after the campaigning period had ended. The court asked the convicts to file two sureties of ₹20,000 each.

25.title: US Treasury Secy Yellen to visit India on Nov 11 for economic meet
25.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will visit New Delhi on November 11 to participate in the 9th India-US Economic and Financial Partnership dialogue. "Secretary Yellen will highlight the strength of the US' partnership with India, which continues to deepen," US Treasury Department said. She will hold a bilateral meeting with Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to discuss India's G20 presidency.

26.title: 6 people, including madrassa students, drown in lake in Telangana
26.article_body: Five madrassa students and their teacher drowned in a lake in Telangana's Medchal-Malkajgiri district. According to the officials of the Jawaharnagar Police Station, the students entered the lake to swim and could not come out after which their teacher also entered the lake. The deceased had come to the Malkaram area to attend a function, police said.

27.title: Family demands martyr status for slain Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri
27.article_body: The family of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, who was shot dead in Amritsar on Friday, has demanded martyr status for him. His son Manik Suri said, "We're demanding status of martyr for my father, suspension of negligent officers & security and another accommodation for us." "Won't cremate him until our demands are met," he added.

28.title: Hyderabad is water sufficient for next 40 years: Water board MD
28.article_body: The Managing Director of Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWSSB), Dana Kishore, said that Hyderabad is water sufficient for the next 40 years. Addressing the Telangana Infra Summit 2022 on the theme 'Physical infrastructure and realty prospects and challenges', Kishore cited an Oxford Cities report and said that by 2030, Hyderabad may have a GDP of $85 billion.

29.title: I check for hidden cameras in my hotel rooms, I'm extremely cautious: Dia
29.article_body: Actress Dia Mirza opened up about the security measures she takes before checking into a hotel room. "A thorough check for hidden cams, getting the hotel to assign a room after arrival, keeping the room number private etc," she said. Dia further said she became "extremely cautious" after "videos of actresses bathing surfaced on the net about a decade ago".

30.title: Delhi LG 'misusing powers', he should fight MCD polls: AAP leader
30.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Saturday criticised Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena and  accused him of "misusing his powers". "Since there's a change in Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) and there are 250 wards now...We want LG VK Saxena to fight the upcoming municipal elections in Delhi," Pathak said. "Let's see whether the citizens support him or not," he added.

31.title: Saw exorbitant amount of money reaching AAP Gujarat office: Ex-AAP leader
31.article_body: After rejoining Congress, former AAP leader Indranil Rajguru said that he saw an exorbitant amount of money reaching the latter's Gujarat state office. "[AAP's] CM face was pre-decided and I was told not to insist and that [MLA] list comes from Kamalam (Gujarat BJP headquarters)...It's a party that befools people. So, I returned to Congress," Rajguru said.

32.title: BMC to concretise, revamp road leading to Maha Dy CM Fadnavis' home
32.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has undertaken concretisation and beautification work of roads near Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis' residence. The total cost of the tender is ₹22.27 crore and the roads which are going to be concretised are Narayan Dabholkar road and J Mehta road. An advanced drainage system and utility ducts will also be constructed, an official said.

33.title: Ind cricket was lacking fitness, fielding side of things before Kohli: Deep
33.article_body: Ex-cricketer Deep Dasgupta said that Indian cricket was lacking in the fitness and fielding side of things before Virat Kohli's impact. "Kohli's impact on Indian cricket is humongous," Dasgupta said. He added, "Kohli looks at himself as an athlete as cricket demands a different fitness skill set...I am so glad that he has got his mojo back."

34.title: NIA arrests 3 PFI workers in Praveen Nettaru murder case
34.article_body: The NIA on Saturday arrested three Popular Front of India (PFI) workers from Bengaluru and Dakshina Kannada district in connection with the killing of BJP Yuva Morcha member Praveen Nettaru. The agency carried out raids at five locations in Dakshina Kannada, Hubballi and Mysuru. Digital devices and incriminating documents were allegedly seized from the houses of the accused.

35.title: BJP offered to drop charges against Jain, Sisodia if we left Guj polls: Kejriwal
35.article_body: AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal has claimed that the BJP offered to dissolve cases against AAP ministers if the party quit the Gujarat Assembly elections. "After Manish Sisodia rejected their offer to be Delhi Chief Minister by leaving AAP, they've approached me now," Kejriwal said. "They've said if you leave Gujarat...we'll spare...Satyendar Jain and Sisodia," he added.

36.title: Case filed against Dr Anahita who drove car that crashed, killing Cyrus Mistry
36.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car in which former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry was travelling during his accident in September, has been booked by police in Maharashtra. Pandole is still in the ICU and is undergoing treatment due to injuries from the accident. Police recorded her husband Darius Pandole's statement. Mistry was killed in the accident.

37.title: ‘Holy mud’ to be used for unveiling of Kempegowda statue in B'luru
37.article_body: A team of four ministers of the Karnataka government visited three historical places in the state to collect the holy mud to be used during the unveiling of the Kempegowda statue. The soil has been collected from Hampi, Kudalasangama and Kitturu. The 108 feet bronze statue at Bengaluru Airport will be unveiled by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 11.

38.title: 19-year-old college student run over by speeding crane dies in B'luru
38.article_body: A 19-year-old college student died at a hospital on Friday, two days after being run over by a mobile crane which was allegedly being driven at high speed in Bengaluru's Whitefield. A CCTV footage showed Noor Fatima, a first-year BCom student, walking on the road before the vehicle hit her. The driver of the crane, Periya Swamy, has been arrested.

39.title: Bank of Baroda posts 59% YoY rise in Q2 net profit to ₹3,313 crore
39.article_body: Bank of Baroda reported a 58.7% year-over-year increase in net profit for the July-September quarter to ₹3,313.42 crore from the previous fiscal's ₹2,087.85 crore. The public sector lender's net interest income surged 34.5% to ₹10,174.46 crore during the second quarter. The bank's gross non-performing assets (NPAs) dropped 22.06% to ₹46,374.4 crore from last September's ₹59,503.82 crore.

40.title: Actor Govinda bumps into his lookalike at Mumbai airport, video surfaces
40.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing actor Govinda bumping into his lookalike, who was dressed in a maroon suit and wore sunglasses, at the Mumbai airport. In the video, the lookalike can be seen presenting a bouquet to Govinda and posing with him for the paparazzi. "Who is the real Govinda?" a fan joked. "Same to same," wrote another.

41.title: Virat Kohli cuts birthday cake with Indian journalists at MCG, video goes viral
41.article_body: Indian journalists covering the T20 World Cup 2022 surprised Virat Kohli with a cake at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on the occasion of his 34th birthday. "Very nice gesture. This is a historic venue and all the media people are here, so it's a very nice gesture," Kohli said. The journalists also presented Kohli with a greeting card.

42.title: Notices sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms
42.article_body: Notices have been sent to 20 rooftop restaurants in Pune for violating norms between November 1 and 4, officials said. "We will be taking strict action against illegal rooftop restaurants...Engineers...are personally visiting these restaurants and issuing notices," said a Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) official. This came after a fire broke out in Lulla Nagar on November 1.

43.title: Musk bought outfit that spews lies across the world: US Prez on Twitter deal
43.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday reacted to the world's richest man Elon Musk's Twitter acquisition deal, saying the latter bought "an outfit that...spews lies all across the world". "There are no editors anymore in America...How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?" Biden added. Musk has called himself a "free speech absolutist".

44.title: When I turn producer, I will tell actors to slash their prices: Rajkummar
44.article_body: Rajkummar Rao, when asked if actors should reduce their prices if their films don't work well, said, "I can't tell others to slash rates...This is the call that...producers will have to take." He added he will ask actors to slash their prices "a bit" when he will become a producer. Rajkummar further said he doesn't charge much for his projects.

45.title: How does the final T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table read?
45.article_body: New Zealand, England and Australia accumulated seven points each in Group 1 of T20 World Cup 2022's Super 12 stage. New Zealand and England advanced to the semi-finals with a net run-rate of +2.113 and +0.473, respectively. Afghanistan finished last on the table with three losses in five matches. Ireland won just one match, while Sri Lanka won two matches.

46.title: I got my first salary at the age of 13: Jaya Bachchan
46.article_body: Veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, in an episode of her granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda's podcast, revealed that she got her first salary at the age of 13. "I don't even know how much I was paid," she added. Jaya further said when she went to study, she paid for her education as she did not want her father to finance her.

47.title: Sharad Pawar flies to Shirdi from Mumbai with doctors to attend NCP meet
47.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar flew to Shirdi today with a team of doctors to attend a party meet. He has been undergoing treatment at the Breach Candy hospital in Mumbai. "I am sure the situation will change...Party cadres wished that I come for the meeting where discussions on the ideology...and policies of the NCP are being discussed," said Pawar.

48.title: You forced me to bring 20-30 people to give ₹500cr cash to AAP: Sukesh to Kejriwal
48.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar, while addressing Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal in a letter, accused the latter of receiving money in exchange for seats. "Kejriwal ji, why you forced me to bring 20-30 more individuals to contribute ₹500 crore cash to AAP in return for seats and postings in AAP Karnataka and Tamil Nadu in 2016?" He alleged.

49.title: Labourers fighting over water fall from Thane building's 2nd floor, 1 dead
49.article_body: Two labourers staying in a building in Thane's Bhiwandi got into a fight over who of the two would go to fetch water from the ground floor. Both of them fell from the second floor of the building, following which one of them died. The other one has been booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

50.title: England reach T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals after win vs SL; Australia knocked out
50.article_body: England advanced to semi-finals of T20 World Cup 2022 after defeating Sri Lanka by four wickets in their last Super 12 stage Group 1 match. England finished second on the points table with seven points and a superior net run-rate than Australia, who have been knocked out of the tournament. New Zealand qualified for semi-finals from Group 1 on Friday.

51.title: Regional parties in T'gana, Andhra are 'match fixing' parties: Jairam Ramesh
51.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said that only Congress can fight with the BJP as all the regional parties in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh are "match fixing" parties. "[All the regional parties] have a good understanding with the BJP. All…are scared of ED, I-T and CBI," said Ramesh. He added that Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra will act as a booster.

52.title: Himanshu Vyas joins BJP after resigning from Congress' primary membership
52.article_body: Former Congress leader Himanshu Vyas joined the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) on Saturday, hours after resigning as the AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Congress and from the party's primary membership. He joined the party at the Gujarat BJP office 'Shri Kamalam' and was welcomed by Union Home Minister Amit Shah and State Party President C R Paatil.

53.title: 57-yr-old BMC official caught while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe, booked
53.article_body: A 57-year-old executive engineer of the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) was allegedly caught by Anti-Corruption Bureau while accepting ₹50 lakh bribe to stop action against a company for illegal construction in Andheri, an official said. The accused was posted at the BMC's K-east ward. A case has been registered under relevant provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act.

54.title: Iranian footballer wears slogan against Iran's hijab rule in ISL match, sent off
54.article_body: Iranian footballer Vafa Hakhamaneshi was dismissed after getting his second yellow card during an Indian Super League (ISL) match in Bengal after he revealed his vest with slogans protesting Iran's mandatory hijab rule. Hakhamaneshi went toward the cameras after scoring his first goal in India and lifted his t-shirt to reveal the slogan "#women #life #freedom for 11:11".

55.title: Russia struggling to train newly mobilised troops: UK
55.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said Russia is probably struggling to provide military training for its current mobilisation drive and annual autumn conscription intake. According to the ministry, newly mobilised conscripts likely have "minimal training or no training at all". "Experienced officers and trainers have been deployed to fight in Ukraine and some have likely been killed in...conflict," it added.

56.title: AIIMS Delhi to provide real-time info on beds from Dec 25
56.article_body: AIIMS Delhi will provide real-time status of beds in its general and private wards from December 25 through a 'Patient Care Dashboard' on its website, a memorandum by AIIMS Director Dr M Srinivas said. The website will also provide statistics regarding radiology tests. AIIMS Delhi has already launched a dashboard to show the availability of beds in its emergency department.

57.title: K-pop band NCT 127 ends concert after 30 fans faint in Indonesia
57.article_body: K-pop band NCT 127 was forced to end their first concert in Indonesia's Jakarta abruptly after 30 people fainted in a crush, police said. During the concert, the fans had started surging forward to get closer to the stage and because of this people fainted, the police added. NCT 127 member Taeyong has apologised for creating "bad memories".

58.title: Russia, China bent over backwards to justify North Korea's missile launches: US
58.article_body: US has accused Russia and China of "bending over backwards" to justify North Korea's ballistic missile launches. During a Security Council meeting on Friday, US also said that Russia and China provided "blanket protection" to Pyongyang from UN's actions. Representatives from Russia and China accused the US of escalating tensions by conducting joint military exercises with South Korea.

59.title: Punjab & Sind Bank's Q2 profit rises by 27% to ₹278 crore
59.article_body: Punjab & Sind Bank reported a 27% rise in its net profit to ₹278 crore in the July-September quarter as against ₹218 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a reduction in bad loans. The lender's total income during the quarter surged to ₹2,120.17 crore. On Friday, the bank's stock closed 8.77% higher at ₹18.60 apiece on BSE.

60.title: BJP sticker seen on car used during IT raid on J'khand MLA, CM reacts
60.article_body: A video has surfaced purportedly showing a BJP sticker on a car in which Income Tax officials arrived to conduct raid at Jharkhand Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal Singh's residence on Friday. The sticker was later removed by a man wearing a BJP stole. Chief Minister Hemant Soren said, "Where lies morality?...[BJP is] robbing the mandate of people using central agencies."

61.title: Iran acknowledges sending drones to Russia for the first time
61.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian has acknowledged that Iran supplied drones to Russia, insisting that the transfer happened before the Russian invasion of Ukraine began. "We gave a limited number of drones to Russia months before the Ukraine war," Amirabdollahian said. Earlier this week, Iran's Ambassador to the UN said the allegations of sending drones were "totally unfounded".

62.title: T'gana CM KCR capable of acting in political field: BJP's NV Subhash
62.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR released a video to back poaching charges against the BJP, the Opposition party has called KCR an actor in the political field. BJP spokesperson NV Subhash called the allegations baseless and unwarranted. "KCR is capable of acting in [the] political field with his lies and dialogues and [can mesmerise] political workers with his lies," said Subhash.

63.title: Mumbai civic body starts resurfacing work on city's 18 roads
63.article_body: After taking verbal permission from the traffic police, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has taken up the work to resurface 18 of the 449 bad roads in Mumbai. "These are small internal roads which need resurfacing as they developed potholes during monsoon," a BMC official said. Out of these 18 roads, 14 are located in the city's western suburbs.

64.title: Man kills his parents & 2 sons, dumps bodies then kills self in Raj
64.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after murdering his parents and two sons, aged eight and 14, police said. The accused apparently dumped the bodies in a water tank before jumping into another tank, an SHO said. The police suspect the man drugged his wife and other family members, who were also present in the house, the SHO added.

65.title: Pharma company adopts African lion at Hyd's Nehru Zoological Park
65.article_body: Manohar, an African Lion, at Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park has been adopted by Aurigene Pharmaceutical Services Limited for a period of one year. According to the zoo officials, representatives from the pharmaceutical company handed over a cheque of ₹1 lakh towards the adoption and maintenance charges of the lion. Last year, the company adopted a Royal Bengal tiger.

66.title: Tata Motors to hike prices of passenger vehicles by 0.9% from Nov 7
66.article_body: Tata Motors on Saturday announced a marginal price hike across its passenger vehicles from November 7. "Effective November 7, 2022, the weighted average increase will be 0.9%, depending on the variant and model," the company said in a statement. "The steep rise in overall input costs has compelled...to pass on some proportion through this minimal price hike," the automaker added.

67.title: UP CM directs Noida, Greater Noida authorities to hire more staff
67.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed senior officials of the Noida and Greater Noida authorities to recruit more staff for smooth functioning. Notably, the Noida and Greater Noida authorities are functioning with only 25% staff, officials said. "We requested the CM if he could allocate personnel from the state government...We are also hiring contractual staff," an official said.

68.title: North Korea fires 4 ballistic missiles as US & South Korea end drills
68.article_body: North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles into the western sea, South Korean military said. Saturday launches come as US and South Korea wrapped up the "Vigilant Storm" exercise they began on Monday. North Korea has launched a series of missiles this week, raising concerns that it could be preparing to resume nuclear testing for the first time since 2017.

69.title: PM Modi condoles the death of independent India's first voter
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday expressed condolences over the death of 106-year-old Shyam Saran Negi who was independent India's first voter. "I bow my head in tribute to him with an emotional heart," he said. Adding that Negi had voted "over 30 times" in his life, the PM further said that this will inspire every citizen, especially the country's youth.

70.title: No communication from DoT since April: Vi on delay in equity conversion
70.article_body: When asked about the delay in the conversion of dues amounting to ₹16,130 crore into equity by the government, Vodafone Idea (Vi) CEO Akshaya Moondra said they are yet to hear from the Centre. "We have had no communication from the DoT since April when there was an agreement...don't know exactly the reason why this is not happening," Moondra said.

71.title: If I'm a 'thug' why did you get ₹50cr to offer RS seat to me?: Sukesh to Kejriwal
71.article_body: Jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar addressed Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal, in a letter on Saturday. "Kejriwal ji, if I'm the country's biggest 'thug' according to you, then on what basis you received ₹50 crore from me and offered Rajya Sabha (RS) seat to me?" asked Chandrashekhar. "What does that make you? 'Maha thug'?" he added.

72.title: Fire breaks out in 15-storey building in Thane; residents evacuated
72.article_body: A fire broke out in a 15-storey building in Thane's Thakurli after an electric meter box in the building reportedly caught fire on Saturday morning. The fire spread across the duct comprising electric wires and reached the top floor, covering the building in thick smoke, fire officials said. Fire, however, didn't enter flats and all the residents were evacuated safely.

73.title: 'Jana Gana Mana, Vande Mataram' have equal status: Centre to Delhi HC
73.article_body: The Centre informed the Delhi HC that "Jana Gana Mana" and "Vande Mataram" both stand on the same level and that every citizen should show equal respect to both. The Center's response was to a PIL that asked the government to frame guidelines for the National Song, giving it the same honour and status as the National Anthem.

74.title: Girl collapses, dies after teacher punishes students at B'luru school
74.article_body: A primary schoolgirl collapsed in her classroom on Friday while a teacher was allegedly punishing all the students of her class at a private school in Bengaluru. She was rushed to a hospital by teachers but was declared brought dead, police said. Later, the school authorities took the girl's body to her home. The child's father has lodged a complaint.

75.title: List party workers to be chosen in civic body: Thiruvananthapuram Mayor to CPI(M)
75.article_body: Thiruvananthapuram Corporation Mayor Arya Rajendran allegedly wrote a letter to district secretary Anavoor Nagappan, seeking the priority list of party cadres to be appointed in temporary posts in the civic body. According to reports, Nagappan has said that he had not seen such a letter and that he cannot confirm if the letter was fake.

76.title: SBI posts highest-ever quarterly net profit after 74% YoY rise in Q2
76.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) on Saturday reported its highest-ever quarterly net profit of ₹13,264.62 crore, up nearly 74% year-over-year, for the July-September quarter. The country's largest state-run lender posted a 15% year-over-year increase in interest earned to ₹79,859.59 crore, while interest expended was ₹44,676.15 crore. At the end of Q2, SBI deposits stood at ₹41,90,254.88 crore.

77.title: They arrested my PA after not finding anything in ED raid: Delhi Dy CM Sisodia
77.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Saturday alleged that the Enforcement Directorate raided his personal assistant's residence in connection with the excise policy case and arrested him. "They got my house raided by filing false FIR...but found nothing against me," Sisodia tweeted. "They didn't find anything in ED's raid at my PA's house, so now they've arrested him," he added.

78.title: Kantara is doing really well, Hindi films are getting their a** kicked: Varun
78.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has said people should take inspiration from films like 'Kantara', 'KGF Chapter 2' and 'Vikram', which are "doing really well". He added that Hindi films are "getting their a**** kicked right now". "It is a good time to be collaborative because cinema, in general, we are going through a big transition all over," Varun further said.

79.title: Jay Narayan Vyas quits BJP ahead of Gujarat polls, says he was fed up
79.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat Assembly polls, former Health Minister Jay Narayan Vyas resigned from the BJP and said that he has kept his options open to join the Congress or the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). "I was fed up with the BJP…I will contest the upcoming Gujarat elections from the Sidhpur constituency," said Vyas.

80.title: BJP MP Mahesh Sharma's close aide attacked in GB Nagar, hospitalised
80.article_body: A BJP worker and a close aide of UP's Gautam Buddha Nagar MP Mahesh Sharma was attacked by unidentified miscreants in Greater Noida, following which he was hospitalised, police said. The victim was with two other BJP workers, police added. Their car was intercepted by around eight unidentified men who were in SUVs and carried arms with them, police stated.

81.title: Russian President Putin calls for 'evacuation' from Kherson region
81.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that civilians in Ukraine's Kherson region should be "evacuated" from the conflict zone. "Those who live in Kherson should be removed from the zone of the most dangerous actions, because the civilian population should not suffer," Putin told pro-Kremlin activists. Kherson is one of the four Ukrainian provinces annexed by Russia in September.

82.title: Peon allegedly rapes teen friend at Delhi govt hospital; arrested
82.article_body: A peon at Delhi government's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital was arrested for allegedly raping a teenage girl, police said on Friday. In her statement, the victim said the accused was her friend whom she had called to meet while she was at the hospital. The accused then allegedly took her to a room in the hospital and raped her.

83.title: MP RTI activist reaches municipality on bullock-cart to collect 9,000-page information
83.article_body: Right to Information activist Makhan Dhakad reached the municipality office in Madhya Pradesh's Bairad town on a bullock cart with a band to collect 9,000-page information in response to his plea. It was a matter of celebration for Dhakad as his application was earlier rejected by the civic body. He had sought information about PMAY around two months back.

84.title: Unacademy's monthly burn down to $7 million from $20 million: CEO
84.article_body: Unacademy CEO Gaurav Munjal has said that the company has brought down its monthly burn to $7 million from $20 million. This was in response to a Twitter user who said, "Oh, the irony. Isn't Unacademy burning millions?" "Winter will get worse. Get to profitability asap...Stop all unnecessary spends. Focus on building great Products," Munjal said in the tweet.

85.title: Timely complaint helps Mumbai Police freeze ₹2 lakh in fraud case
85.article_body: Mumbai's Azad Maidan Police managed to block ₹2 lakh of a complainant in a fraudster's account after she approached them within the golden hours of the cyber fraud. The complainant, Padmini Nayal, got her amount back within 48 hours after police approached nodal officers of various payment gateways. The crime happened when Nayal was searching online for dormitories in Gujarat.

86.title: China vows to continue with 'dynamic-clearing' COVID-19 strategy
86.article_body: Chinese health officials said that the country will use its "dynamic-clearing" approach to deal with COVID-19 cases as soon as they emerge. "We should adhere to the principle of putting people and lives first," China National Health Commission said. China's strict COVID-19 containment approach is still able to control the virus despite the high transmissibility of COVID-19 variants, it added.

87.title: Be cautious of fake messages promising jobs: National Informatics Centre
87.article_body: The National Informatics Centre (NIC) has cautioned the citizens about fake mobile messages that promise jobs on its behalf. "[Fake SMS] was a cyber incident and could also involve a potential financial fraud, NIC promptly reported the incident...and also registered a complaint with law enforcement agencies for identifying and prosecuting the perpetrators of this fake SMS," the NIC said.

88.title: I fell after being shot, 2nd shooter thought I'd died & he left: Imran Khan
88.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan, who was recently shot at multiple times at a rally in Wazirabad, has said he would not have survived if his two shooters had been "synchronised". Khan said he fell after being shot by the first shooter and consequently the other one left, thinking the PTI chief had died. Four bullets had hit his leg.

89.title: Cloudtail fined ₹1 lakh for sale of substandard pressure cookers
89.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on online retailer Cloudtail India Private Limited for selling domestic pressure cookers in violation of mandatory BIS standards. The CCPA directed the e-retailer to recall and reimburse prices of 1,033 such pressure cookers sold to consumers and submit a compliance report in 45 days.

90.title: 15 people killed in fire at Russian cafe after flare gun fired
90.article_body: At least 15 people were killed in a fire at a cafe in Russia's Kostroma city on Saturday, local authorities said. The fire erupted in the early hours after someone apparently used a flare gun during a dispute. Police have opened a criminal investigation into the case and are searching for the person who used the flare gun.

91.title: 56-yr-old woman gives birth to her son, daughter-in-law's baby in US
91.article_body: A 56-year-old woman named Nancy Hauck turned surrogate and gave birth to her son and daughter-in-law's baby in US' Utah. The woman gave birth to the couple's fifth child, a daughter. Her daughter-in-law Cambria shared a video of the baby's delivery on Instagram and wrote, "She was carried and brought into the world by her sweet nana."

92.title: Wipro to roll out 100% variable pay up to team leader levels for Q2
92.article_body: Wipro will give 100% variable pay to employees across fresher and team leader levels for September-ended quarter. The 100% hikes for bands A to B3 come after Wipro reported 14.6% jump in Q2 revenue at ₹22,540 crore. For the rest of the employees, the payout will be based on their unit's target achievement. This year, Wipro promoted 16,000 employees internally.

93.title: Elected govt has to exercise responsibilities: HS Puri on Delhi pollution
93.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, while talking about the pollution situation in Delhi, said that "there are certain responsibilities that an elected government has to exercise". "They are also there in Punjab, look at incidents of stubble burning that had gone up in Punjab," he added. Meanwhile, BJP leader Tajinder Bagga accused Arvind Kejriwal of turning Delhi into gas chamber.

94.title: I earned ₹3,000/month as a teacher in Delhi after getting married: Shweta Bachchan
94.article_body: Speaking with her daughter Navya Naveli Nanda on her podcast, Shweta Bachchan said that after getting married, she had a job as an assistant teacher in a kindergarten in Delhi, where she earned around ₹3,000/month. Shweta stated she was never educated on managing finances, adding, "I was borrowing money (from Abhishek Bachchan) not just in college but in school also."

95.title: Cong always puts obstacles in the way of Himachal's development: Thakur
95.article_body: Ahead of the Himachal Pradesh polls, Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress and said that the party has always put obstacles in the way of the development of the state. "Today, Congress is nowhere left in the entire country. Very soon, people are going to throw them out [of] one or two states where they have governments," said Thakur.

96.title: Putin is trying to 'freeze' Ukraine into submission: US
96.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said Russia is trying to "terrorise the civilian population" of Ukraine with attacks on energy and water facilities. "President [Vladimir] Putin seems to have decided that if he can't seize Ukraine by force, he'll try to freeze it into submission," Blinken added. Ukraine has said that Russian attacks have left 4.5 million people without electricity.

97.title: Sequoia India hires former Uber exec Mohit Abraham as legal head
97.article_body: Sequoia Capital India and Southeast Asia has appointed Mohit Abraham as its Chief Legal Officer. Abraham was the former Legal Head at Uber Founder Travis Kalanick's startup CloudKitchens. Abraham has also been previously associated with Khaitan & Co and Uber. Siddharth V Rao, the incumbent General Counsel at Sequoia Capital India, will now lead data and transformation initiatives.

98.title: War in Ukraine is a frontal, shameless attack by Russia: German minister
98.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock has called Russian invasion of Ukraine a "frontal and shameless attack". After the Group of Seven nations wrapped up talks, Baerbock said, "We are counting every day of this brutal war of aggression...every day is one day too much." In an earlier issued joint statement, foreign ministers called upon Russia to "immediately stop" the war.

99.title: Student beaten, branded with iron box by 4 students in Andhra college hostel
99.article_body: At least four students of SRKR Engineering College in Andhra Pradesh's West Godavari were arrested for allegedly beating up another student with sticks and branding him with an iron box inside a hostel room, police said. A video surfaced online that shows the victim pleading to the accused. He was hospitalised with injuries all over his body, as per reports.

100.title: Kejriwal has turned Delhi into gas chamber: Bagga on pollution situation
100.article_body: BJP leader Tajinder Bagga said that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has turned Delhi into a gas chamber. "People are dying of pollution but he is on political tourism," he added. News agency ANI reported that Bagga also put up a poster comparing Kejriwal to Adolf Hitler outside the Delhi BJP headquarters.

101.title: Man trying to escape from monkeys falls from terrace, dies in UP
101.article_body: A 40-year-old man died after he reportedly accidentally fell from the terrace of his house while trying to escape from a troop of monkeys that attacked him in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly. The deceased was apparently sleeping on the terrace when the incident took place. The man's family claimed that he had suffered a severe head injury and fractured his legs.

102.title: Constant communal tension a violation of right to life: Supreme Court
102.article_body: The Supreme Court said that a constant atmosphere of communal tension is a violation of the constitutional right to life. SC was hearing a 21-year-old petition over the compensation to the families of victims of the 1992-93 Bombay riots and the revival of dormant criminal cases. "There was a failure on the part of the state government," SC stated.

103.title: Car drags bike for 1 km after hitting two men as sparks fly out in Ghaziabad
103.article_body: A video of road rage from Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad has surfaced on social media. The video shows a car driver dragging a bike for one kilometre after hitting two men. Sparks can be seen flying out as the man refuses to stop his car. The car driver has been arrested and the vehicle has been seized.

104.title: Hyderabad company to build Mongolia's first greenfield oil refinery
104.article_body: Megha Engineering & Infrastructures Limited (MEIL) has been given the responsibility to build Mongolia's first greenfield oil refinery on the outskirts of the capital city, Ulaanbaatar. A pipeline and a power plant are part of the refinery's operations. According to the officials, the refinery will generate employment opportunities and support the growth of nearby small industries.

105.title: NIIT acquires US-based St. Charles Consulting Group for ₹192 crore
105.article_body: Talent development company and managed training services provider NIIT said it acquired US-based St. Charles Consulting Group through its wholly-owned subsidiary, NIIT (USA) for $23.4 million (about ₹192 crore). St. Charles Consulting is headquartered in St Charles, Illinois and is a provider of consulting, design and implementation solutions for strategic learning programmes to services firms.

106.title: Pune man kills wife suspecting her character, tries to kill self
106.article_body: A 50-year-old man allegedly stabbed his wife to death and then attempted to die by suicide in Pune's Yerawada, police said. "The accused was suspicious about his wife's character and the couple used to always fight," a police official said. The police admitted the accused to a hospital after he apparently consumed a poisonous substance. The incident occurred on Tuesday.

107.title: 2 miners trapped in collapsed mine in S Korea rescued after 9 days
107.article_body: Two miners who were trapped in a collapsed zinc mine in eastern South Korea since October 26 were rescued on Friday. The survivors, aged 62 and 56, reportedly used an instant coffee mix powder they had with them as a meal. They "endured by drinking any water that dropped inside the shaft", a fire department official said.

108.title: Infosys to give 60% variable pay to select employees: Report
108.article_body: Infosys has mailed some of its staff announcing a 60% variable pay on average for certain levels of its business process management employees for the second quarter of the current fiscal, CNBC-TV18 reported. According to the mail, the pay was to be given out with October salaries. In the preceding quarter, the company had given 70% variable pay on average.

109.title: US to deploy B-1B bombers during joint drill with South Korea: Report
109.article_body: The US Air Force plans to deploy B-1B strategic bombers in joint military drill with South Korea, Yonhap News reported. This comes after North Korea carried out series of test launches. This is reportedly the first B-1B to be deployed in US-South Korean drill since 2017. South Korea urged US to step up deployment of aircraft carriers and nuclear submarines.

110.title: Owner of UP hospital where dengue patient died after platelet transfusion held
110.article_body: The owner of the private hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, where a dengue patient died after getting a platelet transfusion, has been arrested, police said on Saturday. Earlier it was alleged that the patient was given mosambi juice instead of platelets, however, an inquiry panel later concluded that the patient died due to the transfusion of "poorly-preserved" platelets.

111.title: ED arrests ex-BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son in money laundering case
111.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested gangster-turned-politician and former BSP MLA Mukhtar Ansari's son, Abbas Ansari, in a money laundering case being investigated against his father and family, officials said. Abbas is a Suheldev Bharatiya Samaj Party MLA from Uttar Pradesh's Mau Sadar constituency. ED had attached seven immovable assets of Mukhtar Ansari worth ₹1.48 crore last month.

112.title: Govt helping youth get on the path of entrepreneurship: PM Modi
112.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has said that the central government is providing financial assistance to startups to set the youth on the path of entrepreneurship. While speaking at Rozgar Mela 2022 organised by the Government of Maharashtra, PM Modi said that the aim is to provide equal employment and entrepreneurship opportunities to Dalits, tribals and women.

113.title: Virat Kohli celebrates his birthday with teammates in Australia; BCCI shares video
113.article_body: Virat Kohli celebrated his 34th birthday with teammates in Australia, with BCCI sharing a video on Twitter. "Birthday celebrations on in Australia. Happy birthday Virat Kohli," BCCI wrote. Earlier, Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share unseen pictures of Virat Kohli and wrote, "I chose your best angles."

114.title: Trash me all day, but Twitter blue tick will cost $8: Elon Musk
114.article_body: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk is defending his plan to charge $8 fee per month for blue tick on the microblogging site. "Trash me all day, but it'll cost $8," Musk said on Saturday amid criticism from several users, including celebrities over the verification fee. He earlier said Twitter is witnessing a "massive drop in revenue" amid advertisers pausing spending.

115.title: Himanshu Vyas resigns as AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Cong
115.article_body: Congress leader Himanshu Vyas has resigned as the AICC Secretary Incharge of Indian Overseas Congress and from the party's primary membership. A copy of his resignation surfaced online. "Respected Shri Khargeji, I hereby resign as a secretary of AICC as in charge of Overseas Congress. I also resign from the party's primary membership," the resignation read.

116.title: He doesn't need a pep talk, he's charged up: Navya on brother's B'wood debut
116.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda said that she does not think her brother Agastya Nanda needs a pep talk for his Bollywood debut. "He is really motivated and I think he is out there to do really some great work, so I don't think he needs any pep talk from me, he is charged up already," she added.

117.title: Udaan fires 300-350 employees days after raising $120 mn: Reports
117.article_body: B2B unicorn Udaan has fired 300-350 employees to improve the company's efficiency and achieve profitability, reports said. This is the second round of layoffs this year as the company fired 180-200 employees in June. The latest round of layoffs comes days after the Lightspeed Venture Partners-backed firm raised $120 million in convertible notes and debt from existing shareholders and bondholders.

118.title: FIR against Rahul Gandhi after Congress uses KGF-2 songs in Bharat Jodo Yatra videos
118.article_body: MRT Music, which owns the rights to 'KGF: Chapter 2' songs in Hindi, filed a complaint against Rahul Gandhi and other Congress leaders for illegally using the songs in Bharat Jodo Yatra campaign videos. MRT Music said, the party is "violating the laws of the land and infringing our copyright and intellectual property rights". An FIR has been registered.

119.title: Fire breaks out in factory in Delhi's Narela; 2nd incident in a week
119.article_body: A fire broke out in a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area on Saturday, Delhi Fire Services (DFS) officials said. No casualties have been reported so far, DFS chief said. This is the second such incident reported from the area in a week after a fire that erupted at a factory on Tuesday left at least two people dead.

120.title: Delhi nurses to go on mass casual leave on November 16
120.article_body: Nurses in Delhi will go on mass casual leave on November 16, the Delhi Nurses Federation (DNF) on Friday said. If their demands are not met, they will start an indefinite strike from November 30, it added. The demands of nurses include regularisation of services, promotions that are long due and the creation of new posts.

121.title: Cannot fix all problems: UK PM Rishi Sunak amid economic crisis
121.article_body: Amid UK's ongoing economic crisis, British PM Rishi Sunak said the people cannot expect the state to "fix everyone's problems". However, Sunak said he recognised people's anxiety about soaring mortgage repayments and he would do "absolutely everything" he could to "grip this problem". Sunak, who's Britain's first Indian-origin Prime Minister, made these comments during an interview with The Times.

122.title: Twitter fires majority of its employees in India: Reports
122.article_body: Twitter has fired majority of its employees in India as part of mass layoffs that took place globally on Friday, as per reports. The company employed 200 to 300 employees in the country and the layoffs reportedly affected staff across engineering, sales and marketing, and communications teams. There was no clarity available on the severance package offered to fired staffers.

123.title: Forex reserves rise by $6.5 bn, highest weekly gain in over a year
123.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves surged by $6.56 billion to $531.08 billion in the week ended October 28, RBI data showed on Friday. This is the biggest weekly gain in the country's forex reserves in more than one year. The foreign currency assets rose by $5.77 billion to $470.84 billion and gold reserves increased by $556 million to $37.76 billion.

124.title: Apple to roll out 5G in iPhones for Indian users in beta mode next week
124.article_body: Apple will roll out 5G for iPhones in India starting next week to users enrolled in iOS 16 beta software programme. This will allow users on Airtel and Reliance Jio networks to access 5G in parts of India where it's enabled. This option will be available on 5G-enabled iPhone 14, iPhone 13, iPhone 12 and iPhone SE (3rd generation) models.

125.title: Blackberrys unveils its wedding campaign #FitForTheBigDay
125.article_body: Blackberrys launched its celebratory collection with the campaign 'Fit for the Big Day' aiming to enable men to look sharp. As India's leading menswear brand, it offers an exciting new range of western and ethnic wear and empowers men to reimagine their choices for weddings, festivities and celebrations, it said. Customers can book in-store appointments for a personalized experience.

126.title: Fraudsters impersonating as resort staff booked for cheating people in Mumbai
126.article_body: Mumbai Police booked fraudsters who linked their phone numbers to the Green Village Resort on Google Maps and siphoned off money from people. The fraudsters used to offer inexpensive deals to lure the callers into making online payments in advance. According to the resort manager, people have been cheated of various amounts ranging from ₹2,000 to ₹90,000.

127.title: Will name, shame advertisers if they continue to pull out of Twitter: Musk
127.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has said he will "name and shame" advertisers if they continue to pull out of Twitter. This comes after several advertisers paused paid advertising on the platform after Musk's $44 billion takeover. "Twitter has had a massive drop in revenue, due to activist groups pressuring advertisers...We did everything we could to appease...activists," Musk said earlier.

128.title: Bypolls in Odisha, Rajasthan, Bihar, UP and Chhattisgarh on Dec 5, result on Dec 8: EC
128.article_body: The Election Commission of India has announced the date for bypolls in Odisha, Rajasthan, Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Chhattisgarh. The voting will take place on December 5 and the counting of votes will happen on December 8. The bypolls are scheduled in five Assembly constituencies, one each in Odisha, Rajasthan, Bihar, UP and Chhattisgarh and one Parliamentary constituency in UP.

129.title: Fired Twitter employee's 'Won't get to tweet it' tweet goes viral
129.article_body: A tweet by a Twitter employee after he was fired from the firm has gone viral on social media. "Won't get to tweet it, but here it is - the last @Twitter tweet from my team and I...thank you for the honor of a lifetime," he wrote. "Bye literally everyone," the pic shared by him read.

130.title: One of the world's largest spiders with 200 babies found in a car boot in Australia
130.article_body: A man in Australia found the nest of one of the world's largest spider species 'giant huntsman' guarding its egg sac in his car boot. The female huntsman produces a white egg sac of papery silk that carries around 200 babies. The car owner, who killed the spiders, said, "My initial response was revulsion."

131.title: Democracy, rule of law under threat in T'gana, country: Cong's Mallu Ravi
131.article_body: Congress leader Mallu Ravi criticised the BJP, TRS and said that democracy and the rule of law are under threat in Telangana and in the country. "In Telangana, 12 MLAs were taken from Congress to TRS, which is similar to the BJP taking MLAs from TRS. Now, KCR is feeling the heat and he is talking," said Ravi.

132.title: Tourists held by Peru indigenous group protesting oil spills freed
132.article_body: Members of an indigenous group on Friday freed over 100 tourists they held on a riverboat in the Peruvian Amazon a day earlier. The community took the "radical measure" to try to convince the government to assess the environmental damage from oil spills in the region, community leader Watson Trujillo said. The spills occurred in 2014 and September this year.

133.title: Situation of dengue in Lucknow is very pitiable: Allahabad HC
133.article_body: Allahabad High Court on Friday observed that the situation of dengue in Uttar Pradesh's capital city of Lucknow is "very pitiable" even as the state government's records said everything is "fine". The bench, which was hearing the state government's reply on a PIL over the matter, said that it would have checked the records if it had its own agency.

134.title: Pune City Police arrests 2 gangsters wanted in MCOCA case
134.article_body: Pune City Police has arrested two gangsters, Rupesh Marne and Santosh Shelar, both wanted in a Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act (MCOCA) case. This comes after police got information that Marne was meeting his wife, following which officials laid a trap and nabbed him on Thursday. Further interrogation revealed that Shelar was hiding at his native place in Botarwadi.

135.title: Parachute coconut oil maker Marico's Q2 profit dips by 3% to ₹301 cr
135.article_body: Marico Limited, the producer of Saffola cooking oil and Parachute coconut oil, posted a 3% year-on-year drop in its net profit at ₹301 crore for the September quarter. Its revenue from operations increased by 3% year-on-year to ₹2,496 crore with underlying volume growth of 3% in the domestic business and constant currency growth of 11% in the international business.

136.title: Don't see a major disadvantage in 5G rollout delay: Vodafone Idea
136.article_body: Vodafone Idea CEO Akshaya Moondra said he doesn't see a significant disadvantage for the company due to the delay in 5G rollout as the 5G handset market ecosystem has not started evolving. "The competition has already started...so we will be behind them," Moondra added. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel launched 5G services in some parts of the country last month.

137.title: BJP has spread garbage in Delhi, people will vote for cleanliness: Kejriwal
137.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter to urge the public of the national capital to "vote for cleanliness". "In the last 15 years, BJP has spread garbage all over Delhi...created mountains of garbage. This time, on December 4, people of Delhi will vote for cleanliness...they will vote for AAP," he said.

138.title: Pune's AeroMall may be opened to public in 10-15 days: Authorities
138.article_body: Pune airport authorities have said that the AeroMall may be opened to the public in the next 10 to 15 days. The facility had missed its inauguration deadline in October. However, Pune International Airport director Santosh Dhoke has said that the date of opening the facility has not been fixed as some "statutory requirements are going on".

139.title: Urge people to wear masks as Delhi CM is busy in Guj, Himachal: Mandaviya
139.article_body: Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Friday urged people in Delhi to wear masks to protect themselves amid high pollution levels as the national capital's CM Arvind Kejriwal is "busy". "Kejriwal ji is busy talking about free 'rewadi' in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh and putting up advertisements by spending crores of rupees of Delhi taxpayers' money," he claimed.

140.title: 4 dead, 4 injured as 2 cars meet with an accident on Yamuna Expressway
140.article_body: At least four persons were killed and four others were severely injured after two cars met with an accident on Yamuna Expressway. "The two cars met with an accident on Milestone 87 of Yamuna Expressway under Surir Police Station area in Mathura," police said. Local police reached the spot and the injured were taken to Mathura district hospital, police added.

141.title: HNIs tend to be long-term investors: Nykaa CEO as lock-in nears end
141.article_body: Nykaa CEO Falguni Nayar has said that high net-worth individuals (HNIs), many of whom hold stakes in the company, tend to be long-term investors. She said the company was unaware whether its pre-IPO investors would hold their stakes or sell. The statement comes before lock-in of ₹16.48 crore pre-IPO investor shares in Nykaa is set to expire on November 10.

142.title: 'Permacrisis' declared word of the year by Collins English Dictionary
142.article_body: The Collins English Dictionary has announced 'permacrisis' as the word of the year for 2022. The dictionary defines the word as "an extended period of instability and insecurity". According to Collins, the word "sums up quite succinctly how truly awful 2022 has been for so many people". Permacrisis is one of the six words that are new to the dictionary.

143.title: Biden criticises Musk's Twitter buy, says 'It spews lies around the world'
143.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday criticised Elon Musk for purchasing Twitter. "And now what are we all worried about? Elon Musk goes out and buys an outfit...that spews lies all across the world," he said during a fundraiser. "There's no editors anymore in America...How do we expect kids to be able to understand what is at stake?" he added.

144.title: Anushka shares unseen pics of Virat on his 34th birthday, says 'Chose your best angles'
144.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram to share unseen pictures of her husband, cricketer Virat Kohli, on the occasion of his 34th birthday. She wrote, "It's your birthday my love, so obviously, I chose your best angles and photos for this post...Love you in every state and form and way." A fan commented, "Thank you for these pictures."

145.title: Need to assimilate technology for better treatment outcomes: Aarvy Healthcare's Dr Vikram
145.article_body: Aarvy Healthcare Super Speciality Hospital's Dr Vikram Singh, MS (General Surgery) said Indian healthcare ecosystem is rapidly expanding. "Need of the hour is to assimilate technology [for] better treatment outcomes," he stated. "At Aarvy we've implemented smart ICUs. The Mindray powered technology enables...specialists to monitor...patients' stats at the convenience of their handsets," he said.

146.title: India reacts after North Korea fires record number of missiles in a single day
146.article_body: India has reacted after North Korea fired 23 missiles on Wednesday, a record for a single day. "These launches constitute a violation of resolutions of Security Council relating to the DPRK. They affect the peace and security of the region and beyond," Ruchira Kamboj, India's Permanent Representative to UN said. "We also reiterate our continued support for denuclearisation," she added.

147.title: Mom refuses to see, says 'Don't want to watch all this': Abhishek on Breathe 2
147.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said that his actress-mother Jaya Bachchan refuses to watch 'Breathe 2'. "My mother refuses to watch it...She was like 'nahi mujhe ye sab nahi dekhna hai' (I do not want to watch all this), she gets scared...She doesn't like that kind of aggression and violence...So she prefers to go to parliament...where none of that happens," he said.

148.title: Climate activists throw pea soup at 1888 Van Gogh painting in Rome
148.article_body: A group of activists on Friday threw pea soup over a Vincent Van Gogh painting in Rome in a protest they warned will continue until more attention was paid to climate change. They also glued themselves to the wall below the 1888 painting 'The Sower'. Last month, climate activists threw tomato soup over Van Gogh's "Sunflowers" at London's National Gallery.

149.title: What is vestibular hypofunction, the condition Varun Dhawan has been diagnosed with?
149.article_body: Varun Dhawan said he was diagnosed with vestibular hypofunction, a condition in which the balance part of inner ear doesn't work properly. This can occur on one side (unilateral hypofunction) or on both sides of the head (bilateral hypofunction). It can lead to symptoms related to loss of normal balance reflexes, dizziness and postural instability, according to University of California.

150.title: 3 people returning from party die as car hits tree in MP, bodies retrieved
150.article_body: Three people were killed and one was injured after a car rammed into a tree near Bishanpura village in Niwari district in Madhya Pradesh. The incident took place on Friday. Police said the deceased and the injured were returning from a party. "It took six hours to retrieve the bodies from the vehicle using gas cutters," SDOP Santosh Patel said.

151.title: New Zealand man charged for exposing himself, urinating on plane floor
151.article_body: A 72-year-old New Zealand man on a flight from Bali to Brisbane admitted exposing himself and urinating on the floor of the aircraft while sitting in his seat as it began its descent. He has been charged with offensive behaviour. The man had drunk "a number of small bottles of wine" before the incident on November 2, police said.

152.title: Stone thrown at ex-Andhra CM Naidu's convoy; security officer hurt
152.article_body: A stone was hurled by unknown miscreants at the convoy of former Andhra Pradesh CM and Telugu Desam Party chief N Chandrababu Naidu in NTR District on Friday, the district's Police Commissioner said. In the incident, Naidu's Chief Security Officer (CSO), who was reportedly standing behind Naidu, was injured. An investigation is underway, the Police Commissioner added.

153.title: 7 blockchain startups join Mastercard's crypto accelerator programme
153.article_body: Mastercard has announced the addition of seven new blockchain startups to its engagement programme Mastercard Start Path. The aim of the move is to promote the adoption of crypto and blockchain technology. The seven startups are from US, Colombia, Singapore, Abu Dhabi and Dubai. The chosen companies will engage in bridging the gap between Web2 and Web3, the announcement mentioned.

154.title: I know I'm not most good-looking, wouldn't ever get hero's audition: Rajkummar
154.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said there was a time when he would never get to audition for the role of a hero. "I was told to audition for his friend's role. I know I'm not the most good-looking man in the room but Dibakar Banerjee [Filmmaker] saw something in me," he added. Rao was seen in Banerjee's 'Love, Sex Aur Dhokha'.

155.title: Mumbai roads will be cemented in next two years: Maha CM Shinde
155.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde announced that asphalt roads in Mumbai would be converted into concrete roads in the next two years. "Construction of quality roads is being done in Mumbai. The tender process has started. The BMC Commissioner has also been instructed to complete the concrete roads worth around ₹5,500 crore in two years," said Shinde.

156.title: Binance helped Iranian firms trade $8 bn despite US sanctions: Report
156.article_body: Iranian transactions with a value of $8 billion have been processed by Binance since 2018 despite US sanctions, blockchain data showed. Blockchain researcher Chainalysis found that around $7.8 billion moved between Binance and Iran's largest crypto exchange Nobitex. In a recently published blog, Binance said it told Iranian traders in 2018 that they could no longer use the services.

157.title: Hyderabad to get electric double-decker buses soon
157.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) will be introducing 10 electric double-decker buses soon in Hyderabad. "The electric buses would be acquired via [a] tender on rent...The fares and routes would be decided by TSRTC," said a senior official. The buses are likely to run on routes that are free of flyovers.

158.title: Ex-US pilot arrested in Aus has same address as Chinese hacker: Documents
158.article_body: An ex-US military pilot, who was arrested in Australia last month, listed the same Beijing address as a Chinese businessman jailed in the US for conspiring to hack US defence contractors' computers, documents showed. However, it's unclear whether they used the Beijing address at the same time. The pilot, Daniel Duggan, was arrested by Australian Federal Police at US' request.

159.title: RBI encouraged us to go for HDFC-HDFC Bank merger: Deepak Parekh
159.article_body: Amid the RBI tightening scrutiny on large NBFCs, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said the central bank had encouraged HDFC and HDFC Bank to go for a merger. "We knew that they (guidelines) were going to be announced...RBI encouraged us that it is better if we merge...we had disadvantages of being an NBFC and no advantage of a bank," Parekh said.

160.title: HC fines woman ₹25,000 for wanting to add Musk to Twitter case, asks 'Are you serious?'
160.article_body: The Delhi High Court dismissed a plea seeking to implead Twitter's new owner Elon Musk as party to a petition challenging suspension of a user's account. Calling the application "thoroughly misconceived", the court imposed ₹25,000 cost on the woman petitioner. When Justice Yashwant Varma asked, "Are you serious?", the counsel argued that Musk is Twitter's sole director and its shareholder.

161.title: President Droupadi Murmu dances with Sikkim CM's wife; shares video
161.article_body: The official Twitter account of President of India shared a video showing President Droupadi Murmu dancing with Sikkim CM's wife. "President Droupadi Murmu along with Smt Krishna Rai...joined the members of a local dance troupe who performed the 'integration dance' at Gangtok in her honour. The dance captures the diversity, beauty and unity of Sikkim's culture," the caption read.

162.title: Medical education in Hindi also from next year in Uttarakhand: Minister
162.article_body: Medical courses in Uttarakhand will be taught in Hindi also, apart from English, from the next academic session, state Medical Education Minister Dhan Singh Rawat on Friday said. The state Medical Education Department has constituted a four-member expert committee, Rawat added. Uttarakhand will be the second state in the country to teach medical courses in Hindi also, after Madhya Pradesh.

163.title: Danish fintech startup Pleo to lay off 150 employees
163.article_body: Danish fintech startup Pleo will fire 150 employees. "We're no longer operating under 'growth first' mandate but rather a reality of 'growth through focus and efficiency'...what got us here, is not what will get us there," CEO Jeppe Rindom said. In 2021, Pleo raised $350 million and reached a $4.7 billion valuation, becoming one of Europe's most valued fintech firms.

164.title: Varun Dhawan reveals he was recently diagnosed with vestibular hypofunction
164.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan has revealed that he was diagnosed with vestibular hypofunction, a disorder that affects the balance of an individual when the balance system in their inner ear isn't working properly. "Recently, I just shut down. I didn't know what had happened to me. I had this thing called vestibular hypofunction, (where) basically your balance goes off," he said.

165.title: 7 women labourers returning home after work killed as auto collides with truck in K'taka
165.article_body: As many as seven women labourers were killed after the auto-rickshaw that they were travelling in collided with a truck in a village in Chittaguppa taluk in Karnataka. The incident took place on Friday. Eleven people were injured in the incident. Reports said that the women were returning home after working when the accident took place.

166.title: United Airlines suspends ad spending on Twitter after Musk takeover
166.article_body: United Airlines Holdings has suspended ad spending on Twitter, a company spokesperson confirmed late on Friday. With this move, United Airlines has joined major brands such as Cheerios maker General Mills, luxury automaker Audi of America and General Motors to have paused advertising on Twitter, days after the social media platform was acquired by billionaire Elon Musk for $44 billion.

167.title: 50-year-old woman, 6-month-child injured in wall collapse in Pune
167.article_body: A 50-year-old woman and a six-month-old child were injured following a wall collapse at Masewali in Pune's Ganj Peth on Friday evening. The Pune Fire Brigade received the information at around 5.45 pm that the wall of an old house has collapsed. On reaching the spot, officials found that the walls of the ground and first floor had collapsed.

168.title: 32-yr-old man dies in UP Police custody, family alleges 3rd-degree torture
168.article_body: A 32-year-old man allegedly died in police custody in Uttar Pradesh. His family alleged third-degree torture at the hands of the police. The deceased's sister said that he was severely beaten up at the police station. The police, however, said that the man's health deteriorated when they took him for a medical examination and that he died there.

169.title: Rejected by girl, man abuses her, threatens to make her videos in Pune
169.article_body: A molestation case was registered against a 29-year-old man for allegedly abusing a girl. The girl had rejected him after he had proposed to her online, reports said. Following this, the man had allegedly abused her and had threatened to make her videos and defame her in college. The incident took place on November 1.

170.title: ₹20,000 fine for violation of ban on vehicles amid Delhi pollution: Official
170.article_body: Violation of the ban on plying of certain vehicles to curb Delhi's air pollution will attract a fine of ₹20,000, an official said. This comes after the Delhi government banned the entry of trucks other than electric and CNG, except those carrying essential commodities. Four-wheeled diesel light motor vehicles, except BS-VI vehicles, have also been banned.

171.title: Independent India's 1st voter Shyam Saran Negi passes away aged 106
171.article_body: Independent India's first voter Shyam Saran Negi passed away at the age of 106. Negi, a resident of Himachal Pradesh's Kinnaur, cast his postal ballot on November 2 for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Deputy Commissioner of Kinnaur Abid Hussain Sadiq said, "We will go to his home and perform last rites with full honour."

172.title: Let's look at India, talented & very driven people: Putin as he praises India
172.article_body: On Russia's Unity Day on Friday, the country's President Vladimir Putin praised India, saying, "Let's look at India: talented, very driven people with such a drive for internal development." Adding that India will achieve outstanding results in terms of development, Putin stated, "Almost one-and-a-half billion people. Now that's potential."

173.title: Bike hits railing at Delhi's Signature Bridge; 1 dead, 2 injured
173.article_body: A 20-year-old man was killed while his brother and neighbour were injured after the motorcycle they were travelling on crashed into the concrete railing at Delhi's Signature Bridge. The police received information at 5.50 am that the trio was brought to a hospital after the accident, the DCP (North) said. An FIR has been filed in the matter.

174.title: Finnish PM Sanna Marin cleared of misconduct over party video
