174.article_body: Finnish PM Sanna Marin has been cleared of misconduct after a video in August showed her partying with her friends. Dozens of complaints were reportedly filed, alleging her behaviour undermined Finland's "reputation and security". But, Chancellor of Justice Tuomas Pöysti concluded that Marin hadn't neglected her duties as PM. Marin took a drug test after the footage went viral online.

175.title: Twitter lays off 50% of its employees company-wide
175.article_body: Twitter has laid off 50% of its employees company-wide, its Safety and Integrity Head Yoel Roth confirmed. The platform's front-line content moderation staff experienced the least impact, said Roth. Staff in engineering, communications, product, content curation and machine learning ethics were among those impacted by the layoffs. The company's entire human rights team was also cut.

176.title: Mahanagar Gas hikes CNG, PNG prices, auto gas rate up by ₹3.5/kg
176.article_body: The Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) has revised the prices of piped natural gas (PNG) and compressed natural gas (CNG) as it raised the auto gas price by ₹3.5/kg. The piped cooking gas price has been hiked by ₹1.5/standard cubic metre from Saturday midnight in Mumbai and adjoining areas. CNG price in Mumbai is ₹86/kg and the PNG price is ₹24.65/kg.

177.title: 18-year-old boy dies after bus rams into bike at Pune's Katraj Ghat
177.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was killed and another person was injured after a bus coming from the opposite direction rammed into the bike the duo was travelling on at Pune's Katraj Ghat on Friday, according to the police. Senior officials from a police station had rushed to the spot. "We have lodged...complaint," a senior inspector at the police station said.

178.title: No choice when Twitter is losing over $4 million per day: Elon Musk on layoffs
178.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said there was no choice other than to reduce Twitter's workforce as the company is losing more than $4 million per day. The company fired 50% of its workforce on Friday, a week after Musk took over control. "Everyone exited was offered 3 months of severance, which is 50% more than legally required," he said.

179.title: Volkswagen asks its brands to halt paid advertising on Twitter
179.article_body: The Volkswagen Group has asked its brands, which include Volkswagen, Seat, Cupra, Audi, Lamborghini, Bentley, Ducati and Porsche, to pause paid advertising on Twitter. This comes after several brands paused paid advertising on the platform following Elon Musk's takeover. "We are closely monitoring the situation and will decide about next steps depending on its evolvement," Volkswagen said.

180.title: Schumacher’s 2003 title-winning Ferrari could fetch ₹77 crore: Sotheby’s
180.article_body: Seven-time F1 world champion Michael Schumacher's 2003 championship-winning Ferrari car is being auctioned next week in Geneva. The red "Chassis 229" Ferrari raced by Schumacher nine times could reportedly fetch up to $9.4 million (₹77.16 crore). "It's...special because this car is one of the only four cars with more than four wins in Ferrari history," said auction house Sotheby's.

181.title: US announces new military aid for Ukraine worth $400 million
181.article_body: The US on Friday announced its latest military assistance package for Ukraine worth $400 million. The package will include the US paying for the refurbishment of 45 T-72 tanks from the Czech Republic for use by Kyiv, Pentagon spokeswoman Sabrina Singh told reporters. Pentagon said the US would also fund the refurbishment of some HAWK air defence missiles.

182.title: He was upset at not being selected in India's T20 WC squad: Shami's coach
182.article_body: Mohammad Shami's coach Mohammad Badruddin revealed that the India pacer was angry at not being selected for T20 World Cup. "Those pitches suit his bowling. He was upset when the selection didn't happen but never showed it...it [was] my gut feeling that he would play," said Badruddin. Shami was brought in as a replacement after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out.

183.title: Tokyo Olympics bronze changed Indian hockey's face: Defender Rohidas
183.article_body: India defender Amit Rohidas said the team's historic bronze medal-winning feat at the Tokyo Olympics has changed the face of hockey in the country. "Youngsters who didn't play hockey earlier have now taken to the sport in the villages...it makes me feel very good," said Rohidas. He added that kids are eagerly waiting for the 2023 FIH men's World Cup.

184.title: Well thought out conspiracy: Pak leader on attack on Imran Khan
184.article_body: Senior leader of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party Fawad Chaudhry on Friday said the assassination attempt on party chief Imran Khan was "a prelude to a well-thought-out conspiracy". Chaudhry alleged three senior officials in Pakistan's federal government, Shehbaz Sharif, Rana Sanaullah and Major General Faisal Naseer, were "masterminds" of the attack on the former prime minister.

185.title: It's been a long time, can't wait to perform in India: WWE's Bayley
185.article_body: WWE wrestler Bayley said she can't wait for WWE to come back to India. "I know it's been a really long time and I always see their posts...I appreciate your guys' support and I can't wait to come perform for you one day," said Bayley. She will next be competing in a WWE Crown Jewel Championship match against Bianca Belair.

186.title: Iran commemorates 1979 US Embassy takeover
186.article_body: Iran on Friday commemorated the 1979 takeover of the American Embassy in Tehran. State-run television showed people in the capital waving placards with anti-American slogans and some waving triangle-shaped miniature drone-replicas, which suggested the use of Iranian drones by Russia in the Ukraine war. The commemorations were held as anti-government protests continued in parts of the country.

187.title: Britannia's Q2 net profit rises 28% YoY to ₹490 cr, revenue jumps 21%
187.article_body: FMCG major Britannia Industries reported a 28% year-over-year growth in consolidated net profit at ₹490.58 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. During the same quarter last fiscal, net profit stood at ₹381.8 crore. The company's revenue from operations jumped 21% year-over-year to ₹4,379.61 crore from ₹3,607.37 crore. Britannia's direct distribution jumped to 26 lakh outlets.

188.title: Civilians should be evacuated from conflict zones: Russian Prez
188.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said civilians should be evacuated from conflict areas in Kherson. On the occasion of Russia's Day of National Unity, Putin said the civilian population should not suffer. Kherson is one of the four Ukrainian provinces that Russia annexed in September. Putin added 3,18,000 people were drafted into the Army after the mobilisation exercise began.

189.title: Face ED, don't play tribal card: BJP leader to Jharkhand CM Soren
189.article_body: Senior BJP leader Babulal Marandi said that Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren should face the investigation by the Enforcement Directorate instead of playing the tribal card. "If PM Narendra Modi can face SIT questioning while being the Gujarat CM, why can't CM Soren?" Marandi asked. Notably, ED had summoned CM Soren in a money laundering case linked to alleged illegal mining.

190.title: What different do we get from other teams? Roger Binny on claims that ICC favours India
190.article_body: BCCI President Roger Binny has responded to claims that ICC favours India. "Not fair. I don't think we are favoured by ICC. Everyone gets same treatment," he said. "What different do we get from other teams? India is a big powerhouse in cricket but we are all treated the same," he added.

191.title: Delhi court grants interim bail to Sushil Kumar till November 12 due to wife's health
191.article_body: A Delhi court on Friday granted interim bail to two-time Olympic medallist Sushil Kumar, who's the main accused in the murder of wrestler Sagar Dhankar, till November 12. Kumar was granted interim bail due to the medical condition of his wife and two minor children, the court said. The court asked Sushil to furnish a personal bond of ₹1 lakh.

192.title: Thank you from Imran Khan's sons: Ex-Pak PM's ex-wife to man who tackled his attacker
192.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's ex-wife Jemima Goldsmith took to Twitter to react to the news of Imran being shot at during a rally. "The news we dread...Thank God he's okay. And thank you from his sons to the heroic man in the crowd who tackled the gunman," she wrote. A man named Ibtesaam reportedly caught the attacker.

193.title: Bail plea of businessman accused in Andaman rape case rejected
193.article_body: The Calcutta High Court (HC) on Friday dismissed the anticipatory bail application of Sandeep Singh, who is an accused in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands gang rape case in which top officials were named. Further, the police issued a lookout notice against the Port Blair-based businessman. The police earlier announced a reward of ₹1 lakh for information to arrest Singh.

194.title: China’s Xi calls for Russia-Ukraine peace talks
194.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Friday called for peace negotiations between Russia and Ukraine, as he warned of the possibility of a nuclear conflict. Xi made the comments as he interacted with German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who is on a one-day state visit to Beijing. "As influential powers, China and Germany should work together in times of change," Xi said.

195.title: I would be very excited to see India playing in FIFA World Cup: Cafu
195.article_body: Former Brazilian footballer Cafu said that he would be very excited to see India playing in the FIFA World Cup. "Since I have come to India now, I wish India get to play in WC," Cafu said. During his India visit, the Brazilian ex-footballer will feature in an 'All Star' exhibition match along with Indian tennis legend Leander Paes.

196.title: SC denies relief to accused in Telangana MLAs poaching case
196.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday denied interim relief to the three arrested persons who allegedly tried to poach Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) legislators. On October 26, police registered an FIR against three persons for allegedly trying to lure four BRS legislators into defecting. The BRS has claimed that the arrested persons were working at the behest of the BJP.

197.title: 3 Military Engineer Services officials arrested in bribery case
197.article_body: Three officials working at the Military Engineer Services in Bhopal were arrested by the Central Bureau of Investigation for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹1.10 lakh. The accused were identified as Junior Administrative Assistant Arun Singh, Assistant Garrison Engineers JJ Kennedy and RS Yadav. The CBI said during searches at the residences of the arrested incriminating documents were found.

198.title: MS Dhoni moves Madras High Court for contempt proceedings against IPS officer
198.article_body: Ex-India captain MS Dhoni has moved Madras High Court to initiate contempt proceedings against IPS officer G Sampath Kumar for his alleged statements against Supreme Court and certain senior counsels. In his plea, Dhoni said Sampath had made the "defamatory remarks" in his written submissions in a case pertaining to IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal. Sampath had investigated the scandal.

199.title: Forest official injured in crocodile attack during rescue op in UP
199.article_body: A forest official was injured when a crocodile attacked a team of forest officers carrying out an operation to rescue the reptile in UP's Sitapur. The crocodile bit the official's hand, District Forest Officer Mohan Shukla informed. Shukla said they had received information about a crocodile coming out of a lake, following which they reached the spot.

200.title: Probe agency has no right to ask accused for passwords: Delhi court
200.article_body: A Delhi court has ruled that an accused cannot be compelled by an investigation agency to share the password of his electronic devices. "Not only does an accused person has the right to refuse to answer...there is also a rule against adverse inferences being drawn," said the judge. The CBI had filed a case seeking the password of an accused.

201.title: Don't let people below 21 yrs buy liquor: Bilaspur SP to shop operators
201.article_body: Bilaspur Superintendent of Police (SP) Parul Mathur has asked liquor shop operators in the district to not sell liquors to people below 21 years of age and also prohibit their entry to bar shops. In a letter to the operators, Mathur said the shops should be opened after 12 pm and should be closed by 12 am at any cost.

202.title: 2nd airport near Chennai is 'need of the hour': Tamil Nadu govt
202.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government said on Friday that the proposed ₹20,000-crore airport at Parandur near Chennai would help the state achieve its '$1-trillion economy' target. The government said the second airport near Chennai was the "need of the hour", as there was congestion in the Meenambakkam airport. It added that cargo transactions were being shifted to Bengaluru and Hyderabad airports.

203.title: RIL appoints KV Kamath as independent director for 5 years
203.article_body: Reliance Industries Limited (RIL) on Friday appointed veteran banker KV Kamath as an independent director on the company board for a period of five years. Further, Kamath was also appointed as non-executive chairman of Reliance Strategic Investments Limited (RSIL), a wholly owned subsidiary of RIL. RSIL will be renamed as Jio Financial Services Limited (JFSL), the board announced.

204.title: Brazil are no more dependent on Neymar: Ex-player Cafu
204.article_body: Ex-footballer Cafu said that the Brazilian national team are no more dependent on forward Neymar, especially for the upcoming FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "Now Brazil isn't dependent...because there are several players like Vinicius Junior, Rodrygo, Richarlison and Lucas Paqueta...Those players are also capable of winning the cup...but four years ago, it was all Neymar," Cafu said.

205.title: Dogecoin falls 10% amid reports of Twitter pausing crypto wallet plans
205.article_body: Dogecoin's value recently dropped around 10% amid reports that Twitter is pausing its crypto wallet plans. "A recently revealed plan to build a crypto wallet for Twitter appears to be on pause," a report by Platformer revealed. Notably, the meme-based cryptocurrency's value nearly doubled after billionaire Elon Musk acquired Twitter last week.

206.title: Sudhir Suri's assailant runs garment shop, shot him with licensed revolver: Punjab DGP
206.article_body: Sandeep Singh, the assailant of Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri, runs a garment shop right in front of the site, where Suri was protesting with other Sena leaders, Punjab DGP Gaurav Yadav, said. A scuffle broke out between them when he asked the leaders to stop the demonstration, following which he shot at Suri with his licensed gun, Yadav added.

207.title: Spent long time being secondary to men, now women need to have agency: Priyanka
207.article_body: Priyanka Chopra Jonas said she has spent a long time in her career where women have always been secondary to men. "The heroes decide where the movie is shot, who is cast, and what's happening. It is boring," she said. "We are living in a time where women need to be able to have agency in their lives," she added.

208.title: BJP chief JP Nadda holds roadshow in Shimla for Himachal elections
208.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Friday held a roadshow in Shimla for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. While addressing the public, he said, "This election is the election of protection of your rights." He told the public that they've to decide if they want to elect those who've done nothing for them or those who fight for their interests.

209.title: Soren has a lot to hide: BJP on Jharkhand CM seeking time from ED
209.article_body: After Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren sought three weeks time to appear before ED for questioning in a money laundering case, BJP spokesperson Pratul Shah Deo criticised him. He said Soren has a lot to hide because of which he is evading ED summons. "CM Soren is holding a constitutional post, hence he should...be cooperating with the investigating agency," he added.

210.title: Lesson on India's first woman Muslim teacher introduced in Andhra schools
210.article_body: The Andhra Pradesh government has introduced a lesson on Fatima Sheikh, believed to be India's first woman Muslim teacher, in the textbooks of eighth class. AP United Teachers' Federation leader D Ramu hailed the initiative. Sheikh is believed to have pioneered girls' education in India along with Savitribai Phule. Earlier, Maharashtra introduced a lesson on the reformer in school curriculum.

211.title: Public transport should be sustainable, affordable & accessible: Kerala CM
211.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Friday said public transport has to be sustainable, accessible, equitable and affordable and the government was working towards that purpose. Addressing the '15th Urban Mobility India (UMI) Conference and Expo', Vijayan said, "Kerala is the right place to host this conference as we're the second most-urbanised state with 47.7% of...population living in urban areas."

212.title: Varun brought out a side in me that I didn't know existed: Co-star Janhvi
212.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor, sharing her experience of working with Varun Dhawan in the upcoming film 'Bawaal', said, "I had a blast with Varun." Calling the actor a "bundle of energy", she said, "He brought out a side in me which I didn't know existed." Janhvi further said Varun advised her to take up "more commercial and massy films".

213.title: 2 boys dance before bus to make Insta reel in Chennai, get punishment
213.article_body: A video showing two teenage boys blocking a Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus and dancing in front of it in Chennai while making an Instagram reel has surfaced online. Following the incident, police made them spread road safety awareness at the same spot for three days as punishment. Another boy, who recorded the video, was also punished.

214.title: Delhi logs 54 fresh COVID-19 cases, 2 deaths in 24 hours
214.article_body: Delhi recorded 54 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.22% in the last 24 hours, as per data shared by the city health department on Friday. The national capital also reported two deaths due to the infection. The city's active case count now stands at 293. With the new cases, Delhi's total case tally has reached 20,06,443.

215.title: Why bother with how we collect party funds: Karnataka Cong to BJP
215.article_body: The Karnataka Congress has asked the BJP why it was bothered about the party collecting funds from its candidates. The Congress had announced that those aspiring for an Assembly ticket would have to buy a form for ₹5,000 and general category candidates would have to pay ₹2 lakh. The party said no leader has expressed displeasure over the fund collection.

216.title: Audible offers 2 months of free listening, offer ends soon
216.article_body: Audible, a destination for audio storytelling is running a limited period 2-month trial offer that gives customers access to thousands of audiobooks, podcasts and Audible Originals. From access to titles by leading authors such as Amish Tripathi to podcasts and originals voiced by Indian and international celebrities, this offer truly packs a punch, stated the brand.

217.title: I spent a lot of money: Boney on launching brothers Anil and Sanjay Kapoor
217.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor has said he "didn't leave any stone unturned" and spent a lot of money when he launched his brothers, Anil Kapoor and Sanjay Kapoor. Asked why he avoided producing the debut films of his own kids Arjun, Janhvi and Khushi, Boney said, "I decided someone else should launch [them]...I'll invest...as per their market value once they're...set."

218.title: Govt official found hanging at his residence in Jharkhand's Bokaro
218.article_body: A government official was found hanging at his residence in Jharkhand's Bokaro town on Thursday, police said. District Panchayat Raj Officer Raj Shekhar's body was found by his wife after she returned from her morning walk, police added. An investigation is underway to ascertain the cause of the death, which is suspected to be suicide, an official informed.

219.title: In our culture, everybody is roaming around to give advice to players: Akram
219.article_body: Ex-Pakistan skipper Wasim Akram said that current Pakistani cricketers are "big boys" and they know what they are doing. "I am usually not in favour of giving advice because, in our culture, everybody is roaming around to give their advice to cricketers," Akram said. He added, "You won't ask for advice still they will give it."

220.title: Arvind Kejriwal has gold medal in promising freebies: Hardeep Puri
220.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Puri criticised Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal for playing "revdi politics", saying the AAP leader has a "gold medal" in promising freebies. "He will say make the Metro totally free...Luckily, Mr Kejriwal doesn't have to run the Metro," said Puri. The minister added that he would prefer to live in "green Kerala" due to the pollution in Delhi.

221.title: US adds 2,61,000 jobs in October, unemployment rises to 3.7%
221.article_body: US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that total nonfarm payroll employment increased by 2,61,000 in October, and the unemployment rate rose to 3.7%. The number of unemployed persons increased by 3,06,000 to 6.1 million. The jobless rates for adult men, teenagers, Blacks, Asians and Hispanics showed little or no change over the month, the report added.

222.title: AAP lacks intent or policy to handle stubble burning: Haryana minister
222.article_body: Haryana Agriculture Minister JP Dalal said AAP leaders in Delhi and Punjab are indulging in a blame game instead of finding a solution to stubble burning. "It is a matter of right intent, right policy and management," said Dalal, adding that AAP leaders in Delhi and Punjab lack these. He added that pollution from Punjab is "impacting Haryana" as well.

223.title: What is the latest semi-final qualification scenario for T20 WC 2022 Super 12 Group 1?
223.article_body: From Super 12 Group 1, New Zealand have qualified for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals, while Afghanistan, Ireland and Sri Lanka have been eliminated from the race. England-Sri Lanka match will decide which team out of England and Australia will advance to semi-finals. England will reach semi-finals if they beat Sri Lanka, while Australia will advance if England lose.

224.title: Twitter has had a massive drop in revenue, says Elon Musk
224.article_body: Elon Musk, the new owner of Twitter, has tweeted that the micro-blogging platform has suffered a massive drop in revenue. He said it's "due to activist groups pressuring advertisers, even though nothing has changed with content moderation and we did everything we could to appease the activists". "Extremely messed up! They're trying to destroy free speech in America," Musk wrote.

225.title: 8-month pregnant Twitter employee locked out of company laptop night before layoffs began
225.article_body: An eight-month pregnant Twitter employee took to the microblogging platform to share that she was locked out of her company laptop the night before layoffs began on Friday. "Last Thursday in...SF office...really the last day Twitter was Twitter. 8 months pregnant and have a 9 month old. Just got cut off from laptop access #LoveWhereYouWorked," she wrote, sharing a picture.

226.title: Vivek Agnihotri teams up with 'Pushpa' director Sukumar for a film
226.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri and 'Pushpa' director Sukumar are teaming up for a film. Vivek took to Twitter to share the news, writing, "Uniting India with cinema. Details soon." The upcoming project will be produced by Abhishek Agarwal, who has bankrolled films like 'The Kashmir Files' and 'Karthikeya 2'.

227.title: 100 al-Shabab members killed in clashes with Somali forces: Somalia
227.article_body: Somalia's Defence Ministry on Friday said its forces and their allies on Thursday killed at least 100 al-Shabab fighters during clashes in Hiran province. The surrounding areas of one of the villages where the clashes took place have been seized by the government, the ministry added. Notably, al-Shabab claimed responsibility for two car explosions in Mogadishu last week.

228.title: CBI inspects ₹1 crore lottery won by TMC leader Anubrata Mondal
228.article_body: CBI officials on Friday visited a lottery shop in West Bengal where TMC leader Anubrata Mondal bought a lottery ticket, which fetched him ₹1 crore. The officials sought details about the ticket from the shop's owner and employees. An official said the agency suspects the black money earned from the West Bengal cattle smuggling scam was used in lottery business.

229.title: CM Shinde not capable of getting big projects to Maha: NCP's Ajit Pawar
229.article_body: NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Friday criticised the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government and claimed that projects had moved away from the state due to "inefficiency" of the government. "As long as this government is in power, unemployment will only grow," Pawar said. He further alleged that many leaders from the NCP were being offered inducements to leave the party.

230.title: Gold worth ₹46.24 lakh found hidden in trolley lining at Chennai airport
230.article_body: Customs officials at Chennai airport on Thursday seized 1,038 gm gold worth ₹46.24 lakh concealed in the outer lining of a trolley suitcase allegedly belonging to a passenger from Sri Lanka. A video shared by the customs department shows the bag being cut open to reveal a string made of gold that was sewn into the lining of the bag.

231.title: FSDA conducts raid on unit making fake medicines in UP, 2 arrested
231.article_body: The Food Safety and Drug Administration (FSDA) department conducted a raid on a manufacturing unit involved in making fake Ayurvedic and Allopathic medicines in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal and two persons were arrested, police said. The accused were identified as Tej Prakash and Shubham. Fake Ayurvedic and Allopathic medicines worth over ₹1 crore along with a machine were recovered, police added.

232.title: Bhagyashree's husband undergoes 'major' surgery, actress shares update
232.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree, in an Instagram post on Thursday, revealed that her husband Himalay Dassani has been admitted to a Mumbai hospital where he has undergone shoulder surgery. She added that the "major surgery" took close to 4.5 hours. "The reason for sharing this is for people to understand that...even in...surgery this big, recovery can be smooth and fast," said Bhagyashree.

233.title: Centre earns ₹364 crore from scrap disposal during cleanliness drive
233.article_body: The central government has earned over ₹364 crore from the disposal of scrap during a month-long cleanliness campaign in the country, according to Union Minister Jitendra Singh. Over 88.05 lakh square feet of space was freed during the campaign. "It was India's largest office cleanliness campaign. It brought a behavioural change in people concerned," Singh added.

234.title: China to send monkeys to its new space station: Reports
234.article_body: As per reports, China is planning to send monkeys to its new Tiangong space station. They aim to study how these monkeys grow and reproduce in a zero-gravity environment. "These experiments will help improve our understanding of an organism's adaptation to microgravity and other space environments," a Chinese researcher said.

235.title: TVS Motor's Q2 net profit rises 46.78% YoY to ₹407 cr, sales up by 12%
235.article_body: TVS Motor Company reported a standalone net profit for the second quarter at ₹407.47 crore, up 46.78% from ₹277.6 crore in the year-ago quarter. The Chennai-based automaker's revenue from operations grew by 28% at ₹7,219 crore against ₹5,619 crore in Q2 of the previous fiscal. During the quarter, company's overall sales, including exports, grew by 12% at 10.27 lakh units.

236.title: Army jawan swept away by river in Bihar, body found after 4 days
236.article_body: The body of a 22-year-old Army jawan, who was home in Bihar on a holiday, was found on Friday, four days after he was swept away by a strong river current, police said. The incident took place when he was taking a dip in Ganga river along with some friends after Chhath festivities.

237.title: Film industry has created trolling: Amit Sadh
237.article_body: Amit Sadh opened up about the "phenomenon of trolling" and said that he thinks the film industry has created trolling. "We've created trolling, fake likes, fake comments, and fake accounts. I don't need all this," he said. Talking about the paparazzi culture, Amit said he'd never call paps on his birthday as guests would feel he has invaded their privacy.

238.title: China sends spy ship into Indian Ocean days ahead of India's planned missile test
238.article_body: Days ahead of a planned missile test by India, a Chinese spy ship named Yuan Wang VI has entered the Indian Ocean. This comes less than three months after a similar ship had docked in Sri Lankan port of Hambantota. The spy ship has crossed into Indian Ocean and is sailing off the coast of Bali as indicated by MarineTraffic.

239.title: I'm a big fan of Jacqueline, would love to collaborate with her: DJ Snake
239.article_body: French music producer DJ Snake said in an interview that he's a big fan of actress Jacqueline Fernandez and added that he would love to collaborate with her in the future. "I'd...opportunity to meet Jacqueline once in Mumbai and safe to say, I'm a big fan," he added. DJ Snake also said he would like to collaborate with Ranveer Singh.

240.title: Kartik Aaryan inaugurates Ajay Devgn's NY Cinemas in Ahmedabad
240.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan on Thursday inaugurated Ajay Devgn's NY Cinemas in Ahmedabad. Kartik took to Twitter to share a video from the inauguration event and wrote, "After successful opening in theatres to opening theatres #Gratitude." Ajay also thanked Kartik and tweeted, "Next time, we should do this exercise together."

241.title: Patwari inspecting stubble burning held hostage by farmers for 24 hrs
241.article_body: A Patwari inspecting stubble burning was held hostage by farmers for over 24 hours since Thursday afternoon in Punjab. The farmers said they wouldn't release Sukhdeep Singh until they received a written assurance of no FIR or challan over stubble burning. BKU leader Nirmal Singh, whose field the Patwari was inspecting, said, "Officials gave us assurance, so we released him."

242.title: Spain briefly shuts part of its airspace as Chinese rocket debris flies over
242.article_body: Spain briefly closed the airspace over the northeastern region of Catalonia and three other regions on Friday as remnants of a Chinese rocket passed by. The debris of the rocket hit the ocean off Mexico's coast, as per authorities. Around 300 flights were delayed due to the brief closure of the airspace.

243.title: 205 elephants, 512 wildebeests killed by drought this year: Kenya
243.article_body: As many as 205 elephants and 512 wildebeests died due to drought in Kenya's wildlife reserves between February and October this year, Tourism Minister Peninah Malonza said on Friday. The drought also claimed the lives of 381 zebras, 12 giraffes and 51 buffaloes in the same period, Malonza added. Kenya is facing its worst drought in 40 years.

244.title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan says he was hit by 4 bullets, shares X-ray
244.article_body: Former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday stated that he was hit by four bullets in the attack during his rally near Wazirabad on Thursday. He also shared X-ray of his injuries while addressing the nation through a live-stream on YouTube. He sustained a fracture in his right leg, a doctor revealed during the live-stream.

245.title: Edtech startup PhysicsWallah's FY22 net profit jumps 14-fold to ₹97.8 cr
245.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah's standalone net profit grew over 14 times to ₹97.8 crore in the financial year 2021-2022 from ₹6.93 crore in the previous fiscal. The startup's revenue from operations grew nearly 10-fold during the period to ₹232.5 crore from ₹24.6 crore in FY21. Earlier this year, PhysicsWallah raised $100 million from GSV Ventures and WestBridge Capital at $1.1-billion valuation.

246.title: 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' a source of entertainment for people: BJP leader
246.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Friday criticised the Congress and said Rahul Gandhi's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is a source of entertainment for people. He called the initiative a weak move and added that Congress is gradually losing its strength, no matter what they do. "Our government will be formed in...Gujarat and Himachal [Pradesh] following the upcoming Assembly elections," he added.

247.title: J&K LG meets relatives of Kashmiri Pandit killed by terrorists in Shopian
247.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Friday met the family members of Puran Krishan Bhat, a Kashmiri Pandit who was shot dead by terrorists in Kashmir's Shopian on October 15. Sinha offered his condolences to Bhat's wife and his children. The LG has assured that the culprits will be brought to book, Bhat's relative AK Raina said.

248.title: Biden vows to 'free' Iran during campaign speech in California
248.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday vowed to "free" Iran and said, "They are gonna free themselves pretty soon," referring to Iranian anti-hijab protesters. Biden did not expand on his remarks. The statement came during a midterm election campaign speech in a community college in California as dozens of demonstrators gathered outside the venue expressing solidarity with the Iranian protesters.

249.title: Opium addict kills parents and 2 sons in Jodhpur, later dies by suicide
249.article_body: A 38-year-old man allegedly killed his parents and his two sons, aged 14 and eight, and later died by suicide in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said on Friday. According to Lohawat SHO Badri Prasad, the accused was an opium addict. Police suspect the man, who dumped his family members' bodies in a water tank at his house, had earlier drugged them.

250.title: Need more matches against top teams to bridge gap: Ireland skipper
250.article_body: After crashing out of the T20 World Cup on Friday, Ireland skipper Andrew Balbirnie said that they need more opportunities to play against top cricketing nations in order to bridge the gap between them. "We're by no means the finished article, but we certainly are a better team than we were 12 months ago," Balbirnie said.

251.title: Work underway at fast pace: Union Minister on new Parliament building
251.article_body: Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Friday said the construction work of the new Parliament building is going on at a very fast pace. "We have...4,000 people working round-the-clock on it," Puri said. In August, Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore had told Lok Sabha that November is the deadline to complete the project.

252.title: Govt authorities thwart child marriage attempt in Indore
252.article_body: The anti-child marriage flying squad thwarted a child marriage attempt by a family in the Dhabli village of Madhya Pradesh's Indore district. A 17-year-old girl was allegedly getting married to a 21-year-old man before the authorities rushed to the spot and warned the girl's family about the consequences of child marriage, an official said.

253.title: I spent a few years contemplating suicide: Selena Gomez
253.article_body: Singer Selena Gomez, in an interview with Rolling Stone, revealed that although she never attempted suicide, she spent a few years contemplating it. "I thought the world would be better if I wasn't there," she stated. Selena, who was diagnosed with bipolar disorder, stated, "Sometimes it was weeks I'd be in bed...even walking downstairs would get me out of breath."

254.title: Several areas in Bengaluru to witness power cuts this weekend
254.article_body: Bengaluru's electricity manager, the Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM), has listed areas of the city which are set to face power cuts this weekend due to several reasons, including maintenance work. Areas like Malleshwaram, Dollars Colony, Nagashetty Halli and New BEL Road will face power cuts on Saturday, while areas like Peresandra and Chikkaballapura will have power cuts on Sunday.

255.title: Mohammad Nabi steps down as Afghanistan captain after T20 World Cup 2022 exit
255.article_body: Mohammad Nabi has stepped down as Afghanistan captain after his team's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign ended without a victory. "From the last one year...our...preparation wasn't to a level...a captain would want...or needed for a big tournament," he said. He further said he wasn't on the same page with team management and selection committee in some of the last tours.

256.title: 3,18,000 Russian military reservists mobilised: Vladimir Putin
256.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said that Russia had mobilised 3,18,000 military reservists, news agency Interfax reported. Kremlin had earlier said the "partial mobilisation" ordered by Putin would see 3,00,000 reservists being called up to serve in Ukraine. Russia's Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu announced last Friday that the goal to mobilise the reservists had been achieved.

257.title: 132-year-old tunnel discovered at a hospital in Mumbai, pics surface
257.article_body: A tunnel built during the British era in India has been discovered at the JJ Hospital in Mumbai. The foundation stone of the 200-metre-long tunnel mentions the year 1890. An official said the building under which it has been discovered was once used as medical ward to treat women and children, and now it's being converted into a nursing college.

258.title: Congress will cancel Agnipath scheme when it comes to power: Priyanka
258.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has stated that the party will cancel the Agnipath Army recruitment scheme when it comes to power at the Centre. "What we promise, we fulfil," she said, adding, "In Chhattisgarh, we promised farmer's loan waiver and it was implemented." She was addressing a gathering in Himachal Pradesh's Kangra ahead of the state Assembly elections.

259.title: Leopard attacks residents in Mysuru, later rescued by forest dept
259.article_body: A video showing a leopard attacking some residents in Karnataka's Mysuru has been shared by an Indian Forest Service officer online. As per reports, the victims escaped with minor to no injuries. The leopard was reportedly captured and rescued by forest department officials. "Its only mistake was that it was seen. After which people became wild," the forest officer tweeted.

260.title: Would file defamation suit: Karan on Rajeev's allegations about dating his wife
260.article_body: Karan Mehra opened up after Rajeev Sen accused his wife, Charu Asopa, of having an affair with him. Karan said he would rather file a defamation suit against Rajeev. "I had spoken to Charu...at a promotional event in June," he said. "Prior to the event...I...met Charu about 10 years ago," he added. "What romance is Rajeev talking about?" Karan questioned.

261.title: Pune Police arrest couple for illegal money lending
261.article_body: Pune City Police have arrested a couple for allegedly lending money illegally and threatening to kill a borrower. The accused are residents of Dhayari and were identified as Jairam Nivrutti Pokale, 43, and Hema Jairam Pokale, 36. The couple lent ₹6.75 lakh to the victim and even after they were repaid ₹9.45 lakh, the accused demanded more money.

262.title: SC to hear plea seeking intervention on Delhi's worsening air on Nov 10
262.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday said on November 10 it will hear a plea seeking its "urgent intervention" to control the worsening air quality in Delhi. Advocate Shashank Shekhar Jha has filed the petition. Jha said Air Quality Index (AQI) has gone above 500 and that healthy people were also having breathing issues.

263.title: I'm going on 30-day verbal fast, no alcohol, no adult films or intercourse: Kanye West
263.article_body: Rapper Kanye West said that he will be taking a "verbal fast". Announcing a "30-day cleanse", Kanye tweeted, "I'm not talking to [nobody] for a month." "I'm taking a 30 day cleanse. A verbal fast. No alcohol. No adult films. No intercourse. In God we praise. Amen. But my Twitter still lit," his post read.

264.title: Pune civic body to extend door-to-door waste collection initiative
264.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to extend its door-to-door waste collection initiative at a cost of ₹5 crore for the first year of extension. "The agreement of PMC with Swachh Cooperative (organisation of waste pickers) is coming to an end and hence the civic administration has proposed to extend it by five years," said Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar.

265.title: Thane authority plans ₹100 crore city makeover in next 2.5 months
265.article_body: The Thane civic authority is planning to spend ₹100 crore to beautify the city with paintings and colourful illuminations in the next two and a half months. The authority will also focus on clearing construction debris and abandoned vehicles parked in the city. A 25-metre-tall 'pillar of lights' is being constructed on either side of the Anandnagar toll plaza.

266.title: Fridge explodes at Tamil Nadu home, 3 siblings suffocate to death
266.article_body: Three siblings died and two other persons were hospitalised due to asphyxiation after a refrigerator exploded at their residence in Tamil Nadu on Friday. Neighbours reportedly broke open the apartment's door. "We suspect there must have been a blast in the air compressor of the refrigerator caused either due to a short circuit or wire malfunctioning," a police officer said.

267.title: Shah Rukh Khan pushed his body to breaking point for 'Pathaan': Director
267.article_body: Director Siddharth Anand, speaking about Shah Rukh Khan's physical transformation for 'Pathaan', said that he "pushed his body to breaking point" for the action-thriller film. He added that the way Shah Rukh has endured all the pain to pull off the action is unbelievable. Siddharth further said the actor deserves all the love that he's getting for the film's teaser.

268.title: I was told 'whoever debuted with Salman didn't last long': Sonakshi
268.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha, when asked about being told 'whoever debuted alongside Salman Khan didn't have a long-lasting career', said, "This (is) such a sad thing to a newcomer who's just about to start their life." "It was very random at that point of time...I concentrated on...work and that's the only way," she added. Sonakshi made her debut with Salman-starrer 'Dabangg'.

269.title: Ambition is fine, manner of approach is what matters: Gehlot
269.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, without naming anyone, said while it is reasonable to have ambition in politics, it is the approach that makes the difference. He further refused to comment on any alleged internal conflict within the party. The remark comes after former Deputy CM Sachin Pilot pushed the Congress to end the "state of indecision" over the CM post.

270.title: Twitter starts laying off employees in India, fires entire marketing department: Report
270.article_body: Twitter has started laying off employees in India as part of a global job cut ordered by the social media platform's new owner Elon Musk. Twitter has sacked the entire marketing department in India, as per a report. Musk took over the company in a $44-billion deal last week and fired CEO Parag Agrawal and other executives.

271.title: No one seems to care: Biocon chief on condition of B'luru's Hosur Road
271.article_body: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on Friday said that no one seems to care about the condition of Bengaluru's Hosur Road. She tagged Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari and tweeted, "NHAI...isn't doing a great job of [maintaining] Hosur Road. The median is shoddy [and] no one seems to care." She further stated that Bengaluru needs world-class national highways.

272.title: IndiGo Q2 loss widens to ₹1,583.3 cr, revenue surges by 122.8%
272.article_body: InterGlobe Aviation, parent company of IndiGo, reported that net loss in the second quarter widened to ₹1,583.3 crore from ₹1,435.7 crore in the same quarter of previous fiscal. However, the aviation company's revenue from operations increased by 122.8% to ₹12,497.6 crore, compared with ₹5,608.49 crore from the year-ago period. IndiGo reported that passenger numbers jumped by 75.9% to 1.97 crore.

273.title: 3 arrested, contraband drugs worth ₹17 crore seized: Delhi Police
273.article_body: Three persons, including a Nigerian national, were arrested and contraband drugs worth ₹17 crore have been seized from them, said the Special Cell of Delhi Police. The police seized 241 gm of cocaine and 2 kg of heroin from the accused's possession. "The drugs used to be trafficked from Latin America to Africa to India via aerial routes," police said.

274.title: We are too obsessed with money as opposed to content: Abhishek Bachchan
274.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan believes that the film industry has become "far too obsessed about collections and money as opposed to the content". Talking about OTT platforms, Bachchan said, "Fortunately, digital platforms do not put out numbers. It keeps the focus on content." He added, "Good content will always work no matter the medium."

275.title: 5 pigs test positive for African Swine Fever in MP's Katni
275.article_body: As many as five pigs tested positive for African Swine Fever in Madhya Pradesh's Katni, an official said. After the pigs tested positive, a prohibitory order was also issued in the district. "Two zones have been formed for the prevention of the disease. One is 'Infected zone'...and the other is 'Surveillance zone'," Deputy Director of Veterinary Department RK Singh said.

276.title: Bikaji Foods International's ₹881.2 cr IPO subscribed 1.48 times on day 2
276.article_body: Bikaji Foods International's ₹881.2-crore IPO was subscribed 1.48 times on the second day of bidding as it received bids for 3.04 crore equity shares against an offer size of 2.06 crore shares. The portion of the IPO reserved for retail investors was subscribed 2.33 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 1.42 times as of 6 pm on Friday.

277.title: Income Tax Dept raids residences of 2 Congress MLAs in Jharkhand
277.article_body: Around 30-35 officials of the Income Tax Department conducted raids at the residence of Congress MLA Kumar Jaimangal alias Anup Singh in Jharkhand's Dhori on Friday. Premises of Congress MLA Pradeep Yadav in the state were also searched. The searches were reportedly conducted over tax evasion charges. "The searches were carried out under the pressure of the BJP," Jaimangal alleged.

278.title: GHMC to contribute 5% more towards maintenance charges for parks
278.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to increase the maintenance charges by 5% that it pays for 730 colony parks and 34 tree parks from 2023. GHMC used to contribute 75% of the cost of maintaining colony parks, with welfare associations covering the remaining 25%. This will reportedly impose an additional burden of over ₹2.50 crore on GHMC.

279.title: Policemen may lose jobs if found intoxicated on duty: Assam DGP
279.article_body: Assam DGP Bhaskar Jyoti Mahanta has warned that policemen in the state may lose their jobs if found intoxicated during duty hours. New rules will be introduced to check the wrongdoings of policemen who don't work sincerely, he added. He stressed that police should be friendly with the public and shouldn't call people to the police station for petty matters.

280.title: Acting leader of Muslim Brotherhood dies at 85, group says
280.article_body: The acting leader of Egypt's banned Muslim Brotherhood, Ibrahim Munir, passed away on Friday, the Islamist organisation said on its website. Munir died in London at the age of 85. He had been living in exile for most of the last 40 years. The Muslim Brotherhood won Egypt's presidential elections in 2012 but was overthrown by the military in 2013.

281.title: 3 men pose as CBI officers, rob 4 men of ₹6.28 lakh in Mumbai
281.article_body: Mumbai Police are searching for three men who pretended to be CBI officers and robbed four men on their way to the airport to take a flight to Abu Dhabi on Tuesday. The victims were robbed of cash, goods and valuables worth ₹6.28 lakh. As per the complainant's statement, the accused started beating him and snatched his mobile phone.

282.title: Guinea's junta orders legal action against ex-Prez on graft charges
282.article_body: Guinea's military junta on Thursday ordered the initiation of legal action against former President Alpha Conde and over 180 officials from his deposed government for alleged corruption, according to a public document. Conde's government was overthrown last year. The junta's opponents have accused it of targeting Conde's old allies in order to prevent them from contesting the next elections.

283.title: Pune constable attacks woman shopkeeper over parking; suspended
283.article_body: Pune Police have suspended a constable for allegedly beating up a woman shopkeeper over a motorcycle parking issue. The constable had parked his motorcycle outside the woman's shop. When she objected to it, saying it would cause inconvenience for her customers, he started abusing her and assaulted her later. The woman has sustained serious injuries to her right eye.

284.title: Go to Pakistan, don't create it in Bihar: BJP to CM Nitish Kumar
284.article_body: The BJP has criticised Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for his intentions to restore Urdu in schools and accused him of "creating Pakistan" in the state. "In the Muslim-dominated districts...lives of Dalits, OBCs and EBCs get ruined...go to Pakistan yourself," said the Bihar BJP. Kumar had earlier claimed that the Centre was doing little work apart from propaganda for poor states.

285.title: 25-year-old Indian man's post after getting fired from Twitter goes viral
285.article_body: Elon Musk-owned Twitter has started firing employees. A 25-year old Indian man named Yash Agarwal, who got sacked, shared a smiling picture and tweeted, "Just got laid off. Bird App, it was an absolute honour, the greatest privilege ever to be a part of this team...#LoveWhereYouWorked #LoveTwitter." He worked as a Public Policy Associate for Twitter India and South Asia.

286.title: 'Terrorists to arrive in Haji Ali', hoax caller tells Mumbai Police; apprehended
286.article_body: A 36-year-old mentally unstable man was apprehended for making a hoax call to the control room of the Mumbai Police. "The caller...said that terrorists are going to come in Haji Ali...after which a search was done...but we did not find anything suspicious." police said. The police interrogated the man but no FIR was registered and he was sent home.

287.title: She doesn't like violence, prefers to go to Parliament: Abhishek on mom Jaya
287.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan has said his mother, veteran actress Jaya Bachchan, has refused to watch his show 'Breathe: Into the Shadows' as she doesn't like "that kind of aggression and violence". "So she prefers to go to Parliament where none of that happens," he added. Abhishek further said his father Amitabh Bachchan "binge-watched the series".

288.title: 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans raised at BSP rally in UP; video emerges
288.article_body: A video purportedly showing people raising 'Pakistan Zindabad' slogans during a Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP) rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh has surfaced on social media. The rally was organised to campaign for local body elections in Jahanaganj area. Police on Friday detained BSP election candidate Pappu Khan and one of his supporters named Khursheed Ahmed in connection with the case.

289.title: We're aiming to remove range anxiety in EV riders: Taiwan's Gogoro
289.article_body: Taiwan-based Gogoro has partnered with Gurugram-based Zypp Electric, an EV-as-a-Service providing platform, to launch a battery-swapping pilot in India. The companies will launch the B2B program in December in New Delhi with 100 electric scooters. "We're aiming to remove range anxiety in riders. Through our technology, one can go up to 100 kms on every swap," said CEO of Gogoro.

290.title: Less than 1/3rd of Mumbai's bridges in good condition: BMC audit
290.article_body: As per an ongoing audit by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC), less than one-third of the bridges in the city are in sound condition. Of the 340 bridges audited, 54 are in dilapidated condition and need reconstruction. "Audit is an ongoing process and recommendation in the report is not the final word," said Sanjay Kaundanyapure, chief of the bridges department.

291.title: Australia defeat Afghanistan by 4 runs, go 2nd on T20 WC 2022 Super 12 points table
291.article_body: Australia defeated Afghanistan by four runs in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Friday. With the victory, Australia jumped to the second place on the Group 1 points table with seven points. Australia will qualify for the semi-finals if England lose to Sri Lanka. New Zealand have already qualified for the semi-finals from the group.

292.title: Was told Judaai would fail, audience won't accept Sridevi as Anil's wife: Boney
292.article_body: Boney Kapoor revealed that people predicted that 1997 film 'Judaai' featuring Anil Kapoor and Sridevi would flop. "Everybody said...Judaai will bomb at...box office...They said how will people digest the fact...[Sridevi] is married to me, but on screen, she plays Anil's (Kapoor, his brother) wife," he added. 'Judaai', which was reportedly made on a budget of ₹6.3 crore, collected ₹28.77 crore.

293.title: Garmin appoints Yeshudas Pillai as new Country Head for India
293.article_body: US-based wearable brand Garmin's Indian unit has announced the appointment of Yeshudas Pillai as the new Country Head for its operations. In this role, he will be driving stakeholder engagement, growth, and development of the brand in India, according to a statement by Garmin. Garmin aims to add seven new brand stores in the country by 2023.

294.title: Former Meta India head Ajit Mohan joins Snap as Asia Pacific President
294.article_body: Meta's former India head Ajit Mohan is joining Snapchat parent Snap as its President for the Asia Pacific (APAC) region, the company's CEO Evan Spiegel said. "Ajit will provide in-market leadership, lead cross-functional efforts across the region, oversee local operations, and lead our go-to-market strategy," Spiegel said. Meta on Thursday announced that Mohan has resigned after nearly four years.

295.title: Vietnam to remove 'false' content from social media in 24 hours
295.article_body: Vietnam’s Minister of Information and Communications Nguyen Manh Hung has said that "false" content on social media must be taken down within 24 hours, instead of 48 hours previously. Hung told the Parliament that false news spreads widely if handled slowly. He added that penalties in Vietnam for spreading misinformation are one-tenth of level imposed by other Southeast Asian nations.

296.title: Tesla's ex-India policy head Manuj Khurana to join Ather Energy: Report
296.article_body: Tesla's former India Policy and Business Development Chief Manuj Khurana is reportedly joining electric scooter startup Ather Energy. Khurana joined Tesla in March 2021 and quit the US electric automaker in June. He will join Ather as a vice president. Ather raised $128 million from investors, including Hero MotoCorp and the National Investment & Infrastructure Fund this year.

297.title: 57 out of 100 wards reserved in Ghaziabad for civic polls
297.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has finalised the list of reserved wards for the upcoming municipal elections and sent it for approval. As many as 57 wards out of the total 100 have been reserved, with 14 wards being reserved for the SC category, 21 for the OBC category and 22 for women candidates, Municipal Commissioner Nitin Gaur said on Thursday.

298.title: India calls for more clarity on definition of climate finance
298.article_body: The Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change said more clarity is needed on definition of climate finance for developing countries to assess the extent required for climate action. Ahead of the COP27 climate summit, the ministry added, "The goal of $100 billion/year of climate finance by 2020 and every year thereafter through till 2025 is yet to be achieved."

299.title: Video shows Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri bleeding after being shot in Amritsar
299.article_body: A video shows Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri bleeding on the ground after being shot at in Punjab's Amritsar. Some people can be seen rushing to help him. The Shiv Sena leader, who reportedly sustained two bullet injuries, passed away, said a police official. The accused has been arrested, police added.

300.title: Russia likely shooting its own retreating soldiers: UK
300.article_body: The UK's Defence Ministry said that Russian forces have probably started deploying "barrier troops" or "blocking units" that "threaten to shoot their own retreating soldiers" fighting in Ukraine. "These units have been used in previous conflicts by Russian forces," it added. "The tactic of shooting deserters likely attests to the...low morale and indiscipline of Russian forces," it further said.

301.title: Farmers are backbone of rising India: Vice President Dhankhar
301.article_body: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar said that farmers are the backbone of a rising India and also credited industry for driving the agriculture sector on a new trajectory. "Bharat is on the rise [like] never before. It [has] a global recognition…It is the [farmers] who need to be well informed so that [they] adopt economically sustainable measures," said Dhankhar.

302.title: AAP failing to curb air pollution in Delhi: Piyush Goyal
302.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal criticised AAP for air pollution in Delhi and said that people would vote against them. "Despite their big assurances, the state [Delhi] government is failing at all fronts, whether it is air pollution levels, keeping a check on corruption, improving infrastructure, or fulfilling its promises. Delhi residents are...fed up with their hollow promises," said Goyal.

303.title: Umpiring blunder leads to 5-ball over during Australia's innings against Afghanistan
303.article_body: An umpiring blunder led to a five-ball over during Australia's innings against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup 2022. A delivery in the over was mistakenly counted twice on broadcast graphic after David Warner and Mitchell Marsh ran overthrow. Umpires then called 'over' after just five balls were bowled. The score was later corrected, but Australia's innings remained a ball short.

304.title: US-based company Opendoor to lay off nearly 550 employees
304.article_body: US-based property-selling firm Opendoor will lay off about 550 employees, the company's Chief Executive Officer Eric Wu said. "We're navigating one of the most challenging real estate markets in 40 years and need to adjust our business," Wu said. He added that the company earlier scaled back its capacity by over 830 positions, primarily by reducing third-party resourcing.

305.title: India's high crypto tax may kill the industry there: Binance CEO
305.article_body: Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao has said that India's high taxes on cryptocurrency transactions may "kill the industry" in the country. Zhao made the comments during a fintech conference in Singapore. His remarks come months after the Indian government introduced a 30% tax on gains from cryptocurrencies. The government also mandated a 1% tax deduction at source on all crypto transactions.

306.title: Man who threw stones at local train & loco pilot in Chennai held
306.article_body: The railway police arrested a 31-year-old man, K Boopalan, for allegedly throwing stones at a local train and its loco pilot in Chennai after the video of the incident from October 21 surfaced online. The loco pilot was reportedly injured in the attack. According to a press release, Boopalan is accused in several cases including murder, wrongful restraint and dacoity.

307.title: Titan's Q2 profit grows by 33% to ₹857 crore, revenue up by 22%
307.article_body: Titan Company on Friday posted a year-on-year growth of 33% in its standalone profit at ₹857 crore for the September quarter as against ₹641 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. Its standalone revenue grew by 21.8% year-on-year to ₹8,730 crore from ₹7,170 crore. On Friday, Titan's stock on BSE closed 0.18% higher at ₹2,768.30 per share.

308.title: Twitter staff start losing access to work emails & devices amid layoffs, share pics
308.article_body: Several Twitter employees are reporting that they have lost access to their work emails and devices ahead of the company's official email confirming whether or not they will be laid off on Friday. Many of them took to Twitter to share that they had been laid off. Internally, the employees were referring to the layoffs as Thanos' 'Snap' from Avengers.

309.title: Xiaomi misled Deutsche Bank on illegal royalty payments: ED
309.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has accused the India unit of Chinese smartphone maker Xiaomi Corporation of misleading its banker Deutsche Bank for years by claiming it had an agreement for payment of royalties when it had none, according to legal documents. Xiaomi is involved in a face off with ED since the latter froze $670 million of its bank assets.

310.title: Punjab's stubble burning converted Delhi into gas chamber: LG Saxena
310.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena criticised Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann over air pollution in the city and said that stubble burning in Punjab converted Delhi into a gas chamber. He also asked Mann to take "substantive" measures to control the stubble burning. "The cases of stubble burning [in Punjab] have not only continued unabated but increased tragically," said Saxena.

311.title: Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri shot dead in Amritsar
311.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sudhir Suri was shot dead in Punjab's Amritsar on Friday. "Sudhir Suri was shot outside Gopal Mandir, Amritsar during some agitation. He sustained bullet injuries and was rushed to hospital and died," said a police official. The accused has been arrested and his weapons have been seized, police added.

312.title: 14,000 arrested in Iran over anti-hijab protests in last 6 weeks: UN
312.article_body: At least 14,000 people were arrested in Iran during anti-hijab protests over the last six weeks, the UN said. According to Javaid Rehman, Special Rapporteur on the Situation of Human Rights in Iran, those arrested include students, lawyers, journalists. Protests are taking place in Iran over 22-year-old woman Mahsa Amini's death who was detained by morality police over improper hijab.

313.title: Delhi's MCD elections to be held on December 4; results on December 7
313.article_body: Delhi Municipal Corporation elections will be held on December 4 and the results will be declared on December 7, the state election commission announced on Friday. The polls were originally scheduled to be held in the first half of 2022. The elections were postponed after the Centre decided to unify three erstwhile municipal corporations into the MCD.

314.title: Pic of Kerala IAS officer holding her son in arms while giving speech goes viral
314.article_body: A photo shows Kerala IAS officer Divya S Iyer holding her three-and-a-half-year old son in her arms while delivering a speech. She brought her son to the valedictory ceremony of a private film festival. While some pointed out at 'propriety', others backed Iyer. Her husband KS Sabarinadhan, a former legislator, said she took her child as the function was unofficial.

315.title: Delhi reeling under 'pollution of corruption': BJP's Sambit Patra
315.article_body: As air quality in Delhi continued to remain in the "severe" category for the second consecutive day, BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra criticised CM Arvind Kejriwal, claiming that his "intent and integrity" are polluted and that the city is reeling under the "pollution of corruption". "There has been an increase of 34% in stubble burning in Punjab," said Patra.

316.title: Two awarded death penalty for minor's gang rape, attempt to kill in UP
316.article_body: A POCSO court in UP's Pratapgarh awarded death penalty to two accused for gang rape and attempted murder of an 11-year-old girl. The incident took place last year when three people, including a minor, gang raped the girl, threw her on the railway track and ran away, damaging her left eye and bones of her face and leg.

317.title: Boulder falls on home in J&K during landslide; woman, daughter killed
317.article_body: A 35-year-old woman and her 12-year-old daughter were killed after a boulder fell on their house following a landslide in the Dooner area in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch, officials said. A total of four persons were injured, following which they were rushed to a hospital in Surankote. The woman and her minor daughter succumbed to injuries, officials added.

318.title: PUMA invites #KohliCrew to co-create Virat Kohli's mural on his birthday
318.article_body: As Virat Kohli turns 34 on November 5, fans are gearing up to celebrate their hero's birthday in Mumbai by creating a massive mural at Carter Road on Saturday, stated Puma, adding that people are also dedicating special artworks, haircuts, tattoos and more on social media using the hashtag #KohliCrew.

319.title: Cash management company driver runs away with vehicle containing ₹31 lakh
319.article_body: A driver working with a cash management company ran away with a vehicle containing ₹31 lakh in Hyderabad. The incident took place on Thursday when the company staff had gone to refill an ATM machine with cash. When four employees got down to refill cash, the driver ran away with the vehicle, reports said.

320.title: Climate activists who break law must be prosecuted quickly: German minister
320.article_body: Germany's Interior Minister Nancy Faeser told the German Press Agency that climate activists who break the law must be prosecuted quickly and consequently. "These activists place themselves above the law and resort to means that do not benefit the important cause of climate protection," Faeser said. She mentioned an incident in Berlin where protesters glued themselves to a gantry sign.

321.title: GAIL's Q2 profit falls by 46% to ₹1,537 cr, revenue up by 78%
321.article_body: GAIL (India) Limited on Friday reported a 46% year-on-year decline in standalone profit at ₹1,537 crore for the September quarter against ₹2,862.95 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. Its revenue from operations surged by 78% year-on-year to ₹38,479 crore. Sequentially, revenue gained 2.4% from June quarter's ₹37,562 crore. At 3:12 pm, its stock was trading 1.99% lower on BSE.

322.title: Hyderabad man gets 15 days in jail for abusing traffic policeman
322.article_body: A local court in Hyderabad sentenced a man, G Haridas, to 15 days imprisonment for abusing a traffic sub-inspector after he asked the accused to clear pending challans. The court also imposed a fine of ₹500 on him. Haridas was stopped by traffic police at Begumpet on September 9 during a special drive conducted to clear traffic challans on vehicles.

323.title: No job is unimportant: Mahindra on support staff cleaning Team India players' shoes
323.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra praised India's throwdown specialist Raghu who was seen cleaning Indian players' shoes during their rain-curtailed T20 World Cup 2022 match against Bangladesh. "In any community or organisation, there is NO job that is unimportant or irrelevant," Mahindra tweeted. He also said that the picture of Raghu carrying a brush during the match was "pic of the week".

324.title: Utter bullshit: Charu on being accused of having affair with Karan Mehra
324.article_body: After Rajeev Sen accused her of having an affair with actor Karan Mehra, Charu Asopa said, "This is utter bullshit." She also apologised to Karan for "getting involved in this messy thing". "He (Rajeev) is trying to malign his image as well. I'm feeling so bad about it...My husband is really getting dirty and making it ugly," Charu said.

325.title: 1 killed, 1 injured as neighbours fight over water in Mumbai
325.article_body: One person was killed and another person was injured in a fight between neighbours over filling water in Mumbai as both of them fell off the second floor. The deceased, 26-year-old Sadiq Ansari, and the accused, 28-year-old Tushar Singh, were residents of an apartment in Bhiwandi. "Ansari fell on his head which caused severe bleeding and...Singh...suffered some injuries," police said.

326.title: We can't put China and Russia on the same level: EU top diplomat
326.article_body: European Union's (EU) Foreign Policy Chief Josep Borrell on Friday said that Western countries need to reduce their dependency on China but the country cannot be put on the same level as Russia. "It is clear that China is consolidating a new era of its external policy, and internal also, [that] China [is] becoming much more assertive," he added.

327.title: Russia becomes India's largest supplier of crude oil: Report
327.article_body: Russia reportedly became India's largest supplier of crude oil in October. India imported 1.07 million barrels per day (bpd) of crude from Russia last month, up nearly 5% from 1.02 million bpd in September, as per estimates by cargo tracking and analytical services provider Vortexa. However, Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri recently said Iraq was India's largest supplier last month.

328.title: New Zealand become first team to qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals
328.article_body: New Zealand, who are on top of the Super 12 stage Group 1 table with seven points, have officially become the first team to qualify for T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals. This comes as Australia managed a total of 168/8 in their Super 12 match against Afghanistan, meaning they cannot go beyond New Zealand's net run-rate in Group 1.

329.title: Mumbai suburban railway ridership still below pre-pandemic levels: Officials
329.article_body: Central Railway's Mumbai suburban network is yet to reach the pre-pandemic ridership levels. According to CR officials, the option of work-from-home given by employers has been a factor along with other causes like the permanent migration of the labour class. An official said that 37 lakh commuters are presently being ferried, while this figure was 45 lakh before COVID-19.

330.title: Inspector attacks policemen after being caught cheating on wife in Hyd
330.article_body: The wife of an inspector allegedly caught him cheating on her with another woman in a car in Hyderabad on Thursday night. When Vanasthalipuram Police arrived at the scene and tried to take Inspector Raju into custody, he attacked and injured a constable and a home guard. However, police officials overpowered Raju and later booked him for attacking the policemen.

331.title: Russian commander criticised for troop performance goes on 3-week holiday: Report
331.article_body: A Russian military district commander, Alexander Lapin, criticised for the performance of his troops in Ukraine, has gone on a three-week holiday, a regional news agency reported. Last month, Chechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov said Lapin should be stripped of his medals and sent to the front with a gun to wash away his shame with blood.

332.title: Arjun shares old pic with Janhvi, praises her performance in 'Mili'
332.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram and penned a note praising Janhvi Kapoor's performance in 'Mili'. Sharing an old picture with the actress, he wrote, "You're brilliant in #Mili - what a spine-chilling act." "You continue to make me prouder. Your growth as an actor, as a star is phenomenal...And you are just getting started which is...really exciting," Arjun added.

333.title: Attempt to murder case accused escapes police custody in Gurugram
333.article_body: An accused in an attempt to murder case on Wednesday night fled from a hospital in Gurugram's South City-1 area where he was undergoing treatment, escaping police custody, police said on Friday. Praveen Sharma managed to escape from the hospital on the pretext of using the washroom, police added. A head constable has been booked for negligence in the case.

334.title: 2 men make people sign cheques with erasable ink pen in Noida, cheat them
334.article_body: Noida Police have arrested two people for allegedly posing as bank executives and making them sign cancelled cheques with a pen with erasable ink. "The suspects withdraw an amount from the bank account of the victims," police said. The matter came to light when a complainant informed the police that ₹2 lakh was debited from his account.

335.title: Who is Isudan Gadhvi, AAP's CM face for Gujarat elections?
335.article_body: The National Joint General Secretary of Aam Aadmi Party, Isudan Gadhvi, was declared the party's Chief Ministerial candidate for the Gujarat Assembly elections. Before venturing into politics, Gadhvi was a popular Gujarati journalist. He has worked as an anchor on the prime-time news show 'Mahamanthan' on VTV Gujarati. The 40-year-old leader hails from a farmer family in Dwarka's Pipliya village.

336.title: All FIRs against ex-BJP leader over Prophet remarks transferred to Delhi Police
336.article_body: The Supreme Court has directed that all FIRs against expelled BJP leader Naveen Kumar Jindal over his alleged derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammad should be transferred to Delhi Police's Intelligence Fusion and Strategic Operations unit. "No precipitative action or further FIRs against the accused for eight weeks so he can pursue his appropriate remedy before the Delhi HC," SC said.

337.title: 2 20-yr-old students die after losing control of bike on Hyd flyover
337.article_body: Two 20-year-old students riding a motorcycle died after losing control of the vehicle while passing through Hyderabad's Adikmet Flyover on Friday morning. Police said N Bhavan and M Roshan were going at high speed when the vehicle skidded. A total of six friends on three bikes were going to Nallakunta. The deceased were BBA students at a college in Nallakunta.

338.title: Karnataka residents can now register FIR for vehicle thefts online: Police
338.article_body: Karnataka police on Thursday announced that the residents of the state can now register an FIR online if their two-wheeler or four-wheeler is stolen. To file the e-FIR, one must sign up to the state police's Citizen Centric Portal. After logging in, click on the 'vehicle theft' option under the e-FIR category to register the complaint.

339.title: Cipla's September quarter profit rises by 11% y-o-y to ₹789 crore
339.article_body: Pharmaceutical major Cipla on Friday posted a 10.9% year-on-year growth in consolidated net profit of ₹788.9 crore for the quarter ended September. It also reported a 5.6% year-on-year rise in consolidated revenue from operations to ₹5,828.4 crore. Its consolidated margins came in at 22.3% and its EBITDA stood at ₹1,303 crore during the quarter.

340.title: I will 'very, very, very probably' run for US President again in 2024: Trump
340.article_body: Ex-US President Donald Trump said he'll "very, very, very probably" run for President again in 2024. Addressing a rally ahead of next week's midterm elections, he said, "This is the year we're going to take back the House...We're going to take back...Senate. We're going to take back America and then in 2024...we're going to take back our magnificent White House."

341.title: BMC to train and give certificates to domestic helpers in Mumbai
341.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) is planning to train domestic helpers and women from lower-income groups in cooking and medical attendant work. It will also provide certificates upon the completion of their seven-day course. According to the eligibility criteria, the women should hold yellow or orange ration cards and should be earning less than ₹1 lakh per annum.

342.title: NHRC summons Chief Secretaries of Delhi and 3 states over air pollution
342.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has summoned Chief Secretaries of Delhi, Punjab, Haryana and Uttar Pradesh on November 10 to discuss ways of tackling the air pollution menace in the NCR region. "The Chief Secretaries...are expected to inform the commission...about the steps taken by their respective governments to stop the [stubble burning] in their regions," said NHRC.

343.title: Ranveer Singh parts ways with his management agency YRF Talent after 12 years: Reports
343.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has amicably parted ways with Yash Raj Films' talent management agency, YRF Talent, after 12 years, as per reports. He made his debut with Maneesh Sharma's 'Band Baaja Baaraat', bankrolled by Yash Raj Films in 2010. The actor will collaborate with the production house as and when possible, reports added.

344.title: Technology has spoiled on-field umpires, their job is not just to hold sweaters: Akram
344.article_body: Wasim Akram has said that technology has spoiled on-field umpires, adding that they have become "too relaxed" due to over-reliance on third umpires. "I'm all for technology, but if on-field umpires are standing, they also have a job. Their job isn't just to hold sweaters," he added. Akram added that on-field umpires have consistently erred in T20 World Cup 2022.

345.title: Pic of Rajinikanth's lookalike from Pakistan goes viral
345.article_body: A picture of a retired government official from Pakistan who resembles Indian superstar Rajinikanth has gone viral on social media. "After I retired, I started using social media where many people started calling me by that name (Rajinikanth)...I realised that God had blessed me with the looks of a great actor and human being," he said.

346.title: Ravindra Jadeja likely to continue with CSK after MS Dhoni's demand: Reports
346.article_body: All-rounder Ravindra Jadeja is likely to continue with Chennai Super Kings (CSK) after MS Dhoni's demand, as per reports. Jadeja was reportedly not happy at the franchise after being removed as captain mid-way during IPL 2022. As per reports, Dhoni told CSK management that Jadeja's influence cannot be replicated by another player and that he cannot be released.

347.title: Activists jailed for attacking 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' painting in The Hague
347.article_body: A Dutch court has sentenced two Belgian climate activists to two months in prison, one of which is suspended, for attacking the renowned 'Girl with a Pearl Earring' painting in The Hague, Netherlands. On October 27, three climate activists had targeted Dutch painter Johannes Vermeer's painting with glue and tomato soup. The third activist will appear in court on Friday.
