348.title: AAP declares Isudan Gadhvi as Chief Minister candidate for Gujarat elections
348.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party on Friday announced Isudan Gadhvi as its Chief Ministerial candidate for next month's Gujarat Assembly elections. Last week, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal launched a campaign in Gujarat to choose the party's CM face. He had urged people to contact the party through SMS, WhatsApp, voice mail, and e-mail to give their opinion about who should be chosen.

349.title: 8 foetuses found inside 21-day-old baby in a rare medical condition in Ranchi
349.article_body: As many as eight foetuses were found in a 21-day-old baby's abdomen in a rare case of fetus-in-fetu in Ranchi, a doctor said. "As per the papers and journals available so far, one foetus was reported in most fetus-in-fetu cases. Case of eight foetuses hasn't been reported from anywhere yet," he added. The size of the foetuses ranges from 3-5cm.

350.title: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan's party workers shot at while protesting attack on the leader
350.article_body: Several unidentified gunmen opened fire at former Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan's party workers while they were protesting the attack on the leader. Several senior leaders of the party were present at the time but no one was hurt, reports said. The gunmen arrived at the spot in a jeep and opened fire at the protesters before fleeing.

351.title: Minor boy dies by suicide over abuse by father's woman partner in Pune
351.article_body: An 11-year-old boy died by suicide after being allegedly abused and harassed by his father's woman partner in Pune's Lohiyanagar, police said. The victim visited the woman's house with his father and while returning, he was abused and threatened by her and her mother, police added. The minor boy's body was later found hanging at his home, police stated.

352.title: UK facing a 'very challenging' two-year recession: Bank of England
352.article_body: The Bank of England has said that the UK is facing a "very challenging" two-year recession as it raised interest rates to 3%. This would be the longest recession since comparable records began. The Bank of England forecasts inflation will hit a 40-year high of around 11% during the current quarter.

353.title: US firm Runwise raises $19 million in a round led by Fifth Wall
353.article_body: US-based building technology company Runwise has secured $19 million in Series A round led by venture capital firm Fifth Wall. The round also saw participation from real estate owners including New York's Rudin Management and SOJA Ventures. The latest round increased the startup's total equity funding to $24 million. Runwise was founded by Lee Hoffman, Mike Cook and Jeff Carleton.

354.title: Putin orders one-time $3,200 payment for mobilised & contract soldiers
354.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a one-time payment of $3,200 for contract soldiers and those who have been mobilised to fight in Ukraine, the Kremlin said on Thursday. The payment was designed "to provide additional measures of social support", Putin said in a decree.  The minimum monthly wage for contract soldiers is $2,700, almost three times the national average.

355.title: Udaan to begin 2nd round of layoffs amid operation overhaul: Report
355.article_body: B2B e-commerce startup Udaan will fire some contractual workers and sales supervisors in the second round of layoffs as it revamps its operations, Financial Express reported. This comes a week after Udaan secured $120 million in funding through convertible notes and debt from existing investors and bondholders. In June, the unicorn laid off about 180 employees citing changing market conditions.

356.title: Which Indian states have the highest unemployment rate & which have the lowest?
356.article_body: Haryana had the highest unemployment rate of 31.8% among Indian states in the month of October, as per latest data from CMIE. It was followed by Rajasthan (30.7%), Jammu & Kashmir (22.4%), Jharkhand (16.5%), and Bihar (14.5%). Meanwhile, the states that had the lowest unemployment rates were Madhya Pradesh (0.8%), Chhattisgarh (0.9%), Odisha (1.1%), Gujarat (1.7%), and Karnataka (2.7%).

357.title: Teen found hanging in J'khand police station, officer-in-charge suspended
357.article_body: The officer-in-charge of a police station in Jharkhand's Seraikela-Kharsawan district has been suspended after an 18-year-old youth was found hanging inside a cell within the campus of the station. The deceased allegedly used his belt to hang himself to death, police said. The deceased was taken into custody recently for interrogation after he allegedly eloped with a minor girl.

358.title: Time to welcome Finland, Sweden to NATO: Stoltenberg to Turkish minister
358.article_body: Jens Stoltenberg, NATO Secretary-General, has urged Turkey to approve Sweden and Finland's applications to join the military alliance. Stoltenberg said the two Nordic nations had delivered on Turkey's demands and were ready to join NATO. Meanwhile, Turkish Foreign Minister Mevlüt Çavuşoğlu said Sweden and Finland have not yet fulfilled obligations under a deal to clear their bids.

359.title: Work from home announced for 50% Delhi govt employees amid high pollution levels
359.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Friday announced that 50 per cent of Delhi government employees will be working from home amid high pollution levels in the city. Earlier today, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced the closure of primary schools in the national capital from Saturday. The schools in the city will remain closed till the pollution situation improves.

360.title: India's unemployment rate rises to 7.77% in Oct from 6.43% in Sept: CMIE
360.article_body: India's unemployment rate surged to 7.77% in October, according to the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE). It had touched a four-year low of 6.43% in September. The rise was led by an increase in the rural joblessness rate to 8.04% in October as against 5.84% in September after the kharif harvest season, while urban joblessness rate fell to 7.21%.

361.title: 66% schools didn't have internet access in 2021-22 academic year: Report
361.article_body: A report by the Ministry of Education stated that at least 55.5% of schools in the country did not have computer facilities, and 66% were without internet access in the 2021-22 academic year. According to the report, only 2.2% of the schools had digital libraries and only 14.9% of them had smart classrooms, used for virtual teaching.

362.title: NZ defeat Ireland in their last T20 WC 2022 Super 12 match, take their NRR to +2.113
362.article_body: New Zealand defeated Ireland by 35 runs in their last T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. With this, they extended their lead at the top of the Group 1 points table with seven points and a net run-rate (NRR) of +2.113. Meanwhile, Ireland finished their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign with three points in the Super 12 stage.

363.title: Committed to addressing concerns: Lupin on USFDA warning for Tarapur plant
363.article_body: After the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA) sent a warning letter to Lupin over manufacturing errors at Maharashtra's Tarapur plant, the drugmaker said, "We are committed to addressing the concerns raised by the USFDA and will work with the USFDA to resolve these issues at the earliest." It added that this wouldn't disrupt the plant's supplies or existing revenue.

364.title: King Charles had a valet for his teddy when he was in his 40s, book claims
364.article_body: UK's King Charles III was so attached to his childhood teddy bear that he had a person to look after it in his forties, according to a new book. A former nanny to the royal family was called out of retirement for its maintenance, a former valet claimed in the book titled 'The King: The Life of Charles III'.

365.title: Tihar DG Sandeep Goel transferred days after Sukesh Chandrashekar's ₹12.50 cr bribe claim
365.article_body: Days after conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar alleged that he paid ₹12.50 crore as a bribe to Tihar DG Sandeep Goel, the officer has been transferred. Delhi LG Vinai Kumar Saxena on Friday issued transfer orders for Goel. IPS Sanjay Beniwal has been appointed as the new DG of Prisons. A copy of the transfer issue surfaced online.

366.title: China & Germany should cooperate in times of turmoil: Xi tells Scholz
366.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping told German Chancellor Olaf Scholz that China and Germany should work together during "times of change and turmoil", a Chinese state broadcaster reported. During his one-day visit to China, Scholz held his first face-to-face meeting with Xi since taking office. Scholz reportedly said the Russian invasion of Ukraine was creating problems for the rule-based global order.

367.title: South Korea sends fighter jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes near border
367.article_body: South Korea has said that it has scrambled its fighter jets after detecting 180 North Korean warplanes near its border. South Korea scrambled 80 aircraft, including, F-35A stealth fighters, in response. About 240 aircraft participating in the Vigilant Storm air exercises with the United States continued the drills, the military said.

368.title: Urvashi Dholakia shares her pics, says 'Our bodies change with each passing day'
368.article_body: Actress Urvashi Dholakia shared her pictures on Instagram and wrote, "From time unknown, women have been judged! From how they look, to what they wear & how they behave...I as a woman have all the right to be myself." "Our bodies change each passing day & we don't need to be judged for our shapes & sizes," she added.

369.title: Telangana CM KCR releases videos to back poaching charges against BJP
369.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Thursday released video clips to back poaching charges against the BJP. One of the videos shows the 'deal' between agents who were allegedly trying to lure four Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) MLAs to join the BJP. In the video, one of the accused Satish Sharma can be heard offering ₹50 crore each to MLAs.

370.title: Twitter sued over plan to fire 50% workforce without enough notice: Report
370.article_body: Twitter has been sued over a plan to eliminate half of its workforce, about 3,700 jobs, after Elon Musk took control of the company, Bloomberg reported. Employees alleged that Twitter is violating federal and California law by firing them without giving enough notice. Twitter will start laying off staff on Friday and has temporarily shut offices and suspended badge access.

371.title: HPCL stock falls by 4%, nears 52-week low after quarterly loss
371.article_body: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited's shares (HPCL) fell by almost 4% on Friday after the company posted a standalone net loss of ₹2,172 crore for the September quarter as against a profit of ₹1,923.5 crore in the same quarter last fiscal. It saw its worst fall in over a month and neared its 52-week low of ₹200.05 apiece on the NSE.

372.title: 19-year-old woman found dead at home in Ghaziabad, 2 brothers detained
372.article_body: Police detained two brothers of a 19-year-old woman after she was found dead at her home on Wednesday in Ghaziabad. The two admitted to killing her over her relationship with a 25-year-old man they did not approve of, police said. Notably, two audio clips, one in which the woman could be heard seeking help from her male friend, surfaced online.

373.title: Starbucks Co-founder tries filter coffee, masala dosa in B'luru, restaurant shares pics
373.article_body: Starbucks Co-founder Zev Siegl visited the famous Vidyarthi Bhavan restaurant in Bengaluru on Thursday. The restaurant took to social media to share pictures of Siegl enjoying their filter coffee and masala dosa. "It is an honour to enjoy your famous food, coffee...I will take this wonderful experience with me back to Seattle," Siegl wrote in the restaurant's guest book.

374.title: ED raids 12 places in WB, J'khand in illegal land grabbing case: Reports
374.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday raided nearly 12 places in West Bengal and Jharkhand in a money laundering case against those illegally occupying Indian Army lands, as per reports. The places where searches were conducted included the premises of a Kolkata-based businessman Amit Agrawal, reports added. Notably, ED arrested Agrawal last month in connection with a money laundering case.

375.title: 33-year-old employee dies after getting locked inside walk-in freezer in US bakery
375.article_body: A 33-year-old bakery employee has been found dead inside a walk-in freezer in US' New York after he allegedly got locked inside accidentally. The man reportedly got trapped while cleaning out the freezer in the early hours. "We are devastated by the loss of our employee in this accident...We extended our deepest condolences to [the family]," the bakery's manager said.

376.title: Amara Raja Batteries' stock surges most in a decade after Q2 results
376.article_body: Amara Raja Batteries' shares increased the most in a decade after the company reported a 39% year-on-year rise in consolidated profit for the September quarter. The company's board has also approved an interim dividend of ₹2.90/share and the record date for the same has been set for November 16. At 11:29 am, its stock was trading 10.58% higher on BSE.

377.title: Illegal parking lot busted in Gurugram's DLF Phase-2; 4 arrested
377.article_body: Gurugram Police and the CM's flying squad arrested four people for allegedly running an illegal parking lot on a municipal corporation's plot near the Rapid Metro station in DLF Phase-2. The police said that they are conducting raids to arrest the kingpins who have been running the parking lot illegally for the last three years.

378.title: We take responsibility for stubble burning in Punjab: Kejriwal and Mann on pollution
378.article_body: Amid high pollution level, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann held a joint press conference and said, "We take responsibility for the stubble burning in Punjab." Adding that this is not the time for "blame game", Kejriwal stated, "We have taken steps to control it. Stubble burning will come down by next year."

379.title: India gifts 80 vehicles to Nepal for upcoming election
379.article_body: Extending logistical support to Nepal for the conduct of the November 20 election, India on Thursday gifted 80 vehicles to Kathmandu's Election Commission. "These 80 vehicles are part of the 200 vehicles that have been provided to Nepal, at their request," Indian Embassy in Kathmandu said. "The handing over of...vehicles is reflective of close...relationship between India and Nepal," it added.

380.title: 6 local trains cancelled, 70 delayed due to technical snag in Mumbai
380.article_body: The Western Railway's suburban service was disrupted this morning due to a technical snag in Mumbai. At least six local trains were cancelled and at least 70 were delayed. Six long-distance trains were also delayed by about 30 minutes. "All...fast suburban locals are running late by 15-20 minutes. Inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," Western Railway's Mumbai division tweeted.

381.title: Pak police officers suspended for leaking confession of Imran Khan's attacker
381.article_body: Chief Minister of Pakistan's Punjab province Chaudhry Elahi has suspended police officers and other officials for leaking the confession of the suspect who shot at ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan during a rally in Wazirabad. In a confession video, the suspect can be heard saying he "wanted to kill only Imran Khan and no one else" because "he was misleading people".

382.title: Man kicks 6-yr-old in the chest for leaning on his car in Kerala; arrested
382.article_body: A man has been arrested after a video showing him kicking a six-year-old boy in the chest for leaning on his car went viral on social media. Police has registered a case against the man, Shihshad, a resident of Ponnyampalam. Assembly Speaker AN Shamseer said stringent action would be taken against the accused.

383.title: Ireland's Josh Little breaks world record for taking most T20I wickets in a single year
383.article_body: Ireland's 23-year-old fast bowler Josh Little has broken the world record for taking most wickets in T20I cricket in a calendar year. With his hat-trick against New Zealand in T20 World Cup 2022 on Friday, Little took his tally of wickets in T20I cricket in 2022 to 39. He overtook Nepal's Sandeep Lamichhane, who has taken 38 wickets in 2022.

384.title: Reliance in talks to buy 49% stake in Naturals Salon & Spa: Report
384.article_body: The retail arm of Reliance Industries, Reliance Retail, is looking to enter the salon business by buying a 49% stake in the Chennai-based Groom India Salon & Spa, the Naturals Salon & Spa parent, The Economic Times reported citing sources. Confirming the development, CEO of Naturals Salon & Spa CK Kumaravel said that the negotiations are at a 'nascent stage'.

385.title: Delhi primary schools to be shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels
385.article_body: Primary schools in Delhi will remain shut from tomorrow amid high pollution levels in the national capital, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal announced on Friday. Schools will remain closed till pollution situation in national capital improves. Schools in Noida and Greater Noida also decided to hold online classes for students of Classes 1-8 till November 8 in view of rising pollution.

386.title: Ireland become first team to produce 2 hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history
386.article_body: Ireland have became the first team to produce two hat-tricks in T20 World Cup history. Ireland's 23-year-old pacer Josh Little dismissed New Zealand's Kane Williamson, Jimmy Neesham and Mitchell Santner on Friday to take Ireland's second hat-trick in T20 World Cup history. Curtis Campher was the first Irish bowler to take a T20 World Cup hat-trick.

387.title: Apple starts manufacturing iPhone 14 at a second plant in India: Report
387.article_body: Apple's Taiwanese contract manufacturer Pegatron has begun assembling the new iPhone 14 in India, Bloomberg reported. The move makes Pegatron the second Apple supplier to manufacture the iPhone 14 in India, months after Foxconn started its production near Chennai. Notably, the world's largest iPhone plant situated in China's Zhengzhou was recently placed under lockdown after COVID-19 outbreak.

388.title: Sushmita Sen told me if I'm happy without Rajeev, I should separate: Sister-in-law Charu
388.article_body: After initiating divorce proceedings again against Rajeev Sen, actress Charu Asopa said that her sister-in-law Sushmita Sen has always told her to prioritise her own happiness. "She (Sushmita) has said that if I'm happier with Rajeev, then that's what I should do, but if I'm happier away from him, then I should separate," Charu said.

389.title: Apple halts hiring for roles outside R&D to cut costs: Report
389.article_body: Apple has paused hiring for several jobs outside of research and development under its plan to cut costs, Bloomberg reported. It made the decision to freeze hiring last month ahead of its quarterly earnings report. Apple said it continues to hire but given the current economic environment it's taking "a very deliberate approach" in some parts of the business.

390.title: Morbi Nagar Palika chief officer suspended over bridge collapse: Reports
390.article_body: The chief officer of Gujarat's Morbi Nagar Palika Sandipsinh Zala has reportedly been suspended following the Morbi bridge collapse incident that killed 135 persons. Police have arrested nine persons in connection with the incident so far. An Oreva Group manager, Deepak Parekh, who is among those arrested earlier said it was "the will of God" that the incident took place.

391.title: 6 health workers terminated after dog licks blood of patient in UP hospital
391.article_body: Services of six health workers were terminated after a video of a dog licking the blood of a patient in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Kushinagar went viral. Reports said that Kushinagar district magistrate, S Raj Lingam, issued the termination orders. Lingam also sought an explanation from the chief medical superintendent and two medical officers.

392.title: 5-day search operation after Morbi suspension bridge collapse called off
392.article_body: The Gujarat government has called off the five-day search operation that was launched after the collapse of the suspension bridge in Gujarat's Morbi. More than 130 people lost their lives in the incident. State Commissioner of Relief Harshad Patel visited Morbi and announced the end of the search operation, reports said.

393.title: Morgan Stanley to begin layoffs in coming weeks globally: Report
393.article_body: Morgan Stanley is expected to begin a fresh round of layoffs globally in coming weeks, Reuters reported citing people familiar with the plan. In Asia Pacific, the bank has reportedly drafted a list of staff members considered redundant, who mainly work with teams that focus on China-related business. The bank is yet to decide on scale and timing of layoffs.

394.title: When India play, there is a lot of pressure on ICC: Afridi on India-Bangladesh match
394.article_body: Talking about rain-curtailed India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2022 match, former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi stated that there is a lot of pressure on ICC when India play. "Given the amount of rain that happened, the game resumed immediately after the break...India's pressure on ICC is evident," Afridi stated. "There are many factors involved," Afridi further said.

395.title: US embassy officials visit basketball player Griner in Russian prison
395.article_body: Officials from the US embassy in Moscow met detained US basketball player Brittney Griner on Thursday. The officials "saw firsthand her tenacity and perseverance despite her present circumstances", US State Department spokesman Ned Price said, adding that US would continue to push for her release. Last week, a Russian court rejected Griner's appeal of her nine-year sentence for drug possession.

396.title: Nuclear attack on US will result in end of Kim Jong-un's regime: US
396.article_body: After repeated missile launches by North Korea, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said, "Any nuclear attack against the United States or its allies and partners, including the use of non-strategic nuclear weapons, is unacceptable." "It will result in the end of the Kim regime," he further said. North Korea launched over 20 missiles on Wednesday.

397.title: Are we thieves, murderers; don't we have engagements: Soren on ED summons
397.article_body: While speaking about the summons issued to him by the Enforcement Directorate, Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren asked, "Do you think we are 'chor-uchakke' (thieves) or 'hatyare' (murderers)? They issued the summons yesterday (Wednesday) and asked me to appear today (Thursday)." "Don't we have our engagements?" he further asked while saying that he was already invited to an event.

398.title: Twitter down for several users in India
398.article_body: Twitter was down for several users in India on Friday morning, with many reporting that they were unable to log into the website. A popup saying, "Something went wrong, but don't worry-try again", was shown to users trying to access the site. Notably, the outage was reported hours after news broke that Twitter will start laying off staff today.

399.title: Cong promises up to 300 units of free electricity ahead of Gujarat polls
399.article_body: Ahead of the Gujarat polls, Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge announced 10 promises, including subsidised or free services in the health care, farm and electricity sectors. "LPG cylinders for ₹500, free electricity for up to 300 units, free treatment and medicines up to ₹10 lakh, loan waivers for up to ₹3 lakh for farmers," said Kharge.

400.title: Amazon pauses hiring in corporate workforce for the next few months
400.article_body: Amazon is pausing corporate workforce hiring as the e-commerce firm deals with an "unusual macro-economic environment", Beth Galetti, Senior Vice-president of People Experience and Technology, said. "We anticipate keeping this pause in place for the next few months...will continue to monitor what we're seeing in the economy and the business to adjust as we think makes sense," she added.

401.title: French Parliament suspended as MP shouts 'Go back to Africa' at black MP
401.article_body: France's lower house of Parliament was suspended on Thursday after a far-right MP shouted, "Go back to Africa!" as a Black legislator talked about immigration. Grégoire de Fournas later said his remark wasn't aimed at MP Carlos Bilongo but at migrants trying to reach Europe by sea. "There's no room for racism in our democracy," French PM Elisabeth Borne said.
